name: Westboro Village Executive Suite
description: A tastefully decorated and well equipped upper level apartment with a private walk-up entrance and free parking. In the heart of Westboro Village, one of Ottawa's most desirable neighbourhoods—Enjoy a central location without the hassles of downtown.
neighborhood_overview: Westboro Village is a century-old community, and was once the heart of Nepean Township. The old stone town hall still proudly stands on Richmond Road, the original route westward from Bytown. Three blocks to the west is Maplelawn manor, Ottawa's second oldest building (built in 1831) and a National Historic site, which now houses a Keg steak restaurant and features a vintage walled garden open to the public.
host_about:
My adventurous spirit was awakened when I went on a three-month backpacking trip around Europe after I graduated from university. Each and every year since, I've made a point of travelling somewhere different and interesting. I later discovered my passion for bicycle touring and most of my journeys from 1994 on have been on two wheels. I enjoy meeting new people, and for me, welcoming guests to my home often feels like travelling without leaving the house.

I am an industrial designer by training, but I have specialized in exhibit and environmental graphic design. Most of my work is with the national museums in Ottawa and with the National Capital Commission. I have lived in Ottawa for over three decades and have acquired a fondness for Ottawa's history and culture and try my best to pass on its stories and traditions.

Living in an area that is a confluence of rivers and waterways, I am also an avid paddler. I enjoy taking people on a canoe or kayak out on the Ottawa River to experience its special spirit, or on the Rideau Canal for its rich heritage.

name: Basement Studio - Old Ottawa East
neighborhood_overview: The worlds longest skating rink, a UNESCO heritage site, the Rideau Canal, is only a 5  minute walk. The General Hospital and CHEO on Smyth, are a 5 minute drive. Our neighborhood is very pedestrian and green. The nearby Brentwood park features open air tennis courts.
host_about: We love to slow travel throughout the world without a strict itinerary, taking time to discover and immerse ourselves in the rich cultures, customs, languages and architecture of the countries we visit. We are always humbled by what we learn.

name: Private entrance apartment, 3-bdrm - up to 8 guest
description:
GREAT for a family or a group. The apt. is lower level of our house.

No party, no smoke in the Apt. No breakfast provided.

Kitchen, bathroom, eating & living areas, 3 bedrooms, 3 queen beds, plus 1 single bed & 1 futon of double size.

Safe & quiet neighborhood; Buses nearby, driveway parking for 2 cars, and street parking. Internet included.

Please introduce yourself and other guests - age, gender, relationships, smoking? As your host, we would like to know you before open our door. Thanks
neighborhood_overview: Backstreet, small family oriented, peaceful, clean and quiet
host_about:
We have been living in Ottawa for years. I work for Canadian government. We are a big family who loves traveling and talking with people . We used Airbnb a lot therefore  understand what travelers need the most. We would  provide the best services. Our place is clean, safe and quiet. 

We believe using Airbnb is like making friends worldwide. Please introduce yourself, what brings you to Ottawa, where you are from, age, smoking or not, etc...

name: Adorable 2 bdrm, Central Ottawa PD1
description:
This an adorable property with two bedrooms, full bathroom, kitchen with island bar and dining table, living room, summer sun room, backyard patio and deck and garden. A lovely boutique property at 800 sq feet suits a couple perfectly:)

We prefer guests who have Airbnb references.
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the trediest, most walkable neighbourhoods in Ottawa. Close to shops, restaurants, bike and walking paths, beaches, live theatre, art galleries...it is a great location to enjoy Ottawa from.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

name: Smart flat near Center&Glebe+Garage
description: Private studio apartment in new/modern condo building, centrally located, all your basic needs including free indoor parking, ensuite laundry, cable TV, Wi-Fi, 2 burner cook top, frig, microwave, dishwasher
neighborhood_overview: Be close to everything, 15 minutes from the Parliament building complex, the night and bustling neighborhoods, shopping, the good restuarants, museums, canal, the Chinese neighborhood, and still be in a super safe, residential area, in a quiet and quiet building.
host_about:
Welcome to the National Capital of Canada, our beautiful Ottawa!!!

Our favourite hobbies now are gardening in summer and skiing when there is snow. 
We love to entertain in all seasons and to attend theater evenings, concerts and restaurants -that is why our condos are so well located!!! So close to all Ottawa major attractions, from Parliament Hill to Dows Lake and our home is in the country side -sort of- in a 3 acres property in the West end, 30 minutes drive,  looking over a valley, with lots of gardens, some natural and wild too, and partial on the Alvar ecosystem - a natural formation very dry and rocky.

When we travel, we also prefer location, location, location. Second  only by spotless clean accomodations. A good bed, good shower, pillows and best food. We travelled extensively by now to nearly all continents - by train, car, air or sea. 

Maria, a Journalist who became an Interior Designer is originally from Brazil living in Canada from more than 20 years. She loves cooking, reading and movies, when is not traveling, mostly to Europe or South America. "My background includes Law, Communications and Romanic Languages, I still practice Interior Design on part time, a passion of mine".

Jim is a retired professional from high tech who loves nature and family life. "Originally from Nova Scotia, lived most of my mature life in the National Capital Region of Canada". 

AirBnB is a new experience for us, who love trying new paths, and we look forward to welcoming you!!! 
To those that can stay in our home in a sort of rural environment, near Kanata, in the West of Hwy 417, we are proud of sharing our gardens, when the season allows. One should at least try!!!

name: Lakehouse Inspired Retreat Close to Downtown
description: The perfect location! Minutes from Parliament, Byward market, Gatineau Hills, Spa Nordik, national museums and conference centres. Our custom home is on the National Marathon route with easy access to HWY 417. While our home is a work in progress, you will feel welcomed by a luxurious eat-in kitchen, relaxing large front porch, spa bath and spacious light filled rooms. We have welcomed  families, small group retreats, movie crews and conference attendees.  OMDC television & media also welcome.
neighborhood_overview: A quiet tree lined area only a few minute walk to a local lake for swimming, the river pathway for running/biking or walking...beautiful sunsets and views of Quebec across the river. We are located steps from the number 7 bus route and in walking distance of a corner store and restaurants and coffee shops.
host_about: I am a photographer based in Canada's national capital. While we love to bike, ski and cottage close to home, our wanderlust and sense of adventure have us exploring whenever opportunity allows. We have benefited from being welcomed in many AirBnB homes and are happy to extend this to you as well.

name: Country charm, 15min to Kanata, Parking
description: Style, comfort, practicality: this bright new very clean apartment with 1 bdrm+Den w/ full kitchen & private entrance in a family community only 8 min. drive to grocery store and pharmacy, set in 3 acres property among gardens & birds. 35 min. drive to Ottawa center.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the West, only 15 minutes drive from the high tech hub of Kanata (by March Road or Hwy 417) between the lovely towns of Carp and Almonte, in this estate community of Corkery, approximately 35 minutes from downtown Ottawa, as there are 0 traffic lights between our house and the Hwy exits downtown.

Perfect for those driving from Toronto who want to avoid the rush hours, because we are located 15 minutes West from the exit of Hwy 416 and few minutes from Hwy 7. And yes, you need a car here.
In Kanata there are all sort of restaurants, bars, pubs, shopping, the Canadian Tire Centre, the Wave Pool, Bayshore Shopping Mall, Kanata Centrum and more. Some great places to eat few minutes from home as in the famous "The Swan at Carp" and its real canadian seasonal menu, from regular fare to bison and locally made chocolates...wow!

Nearby there are several Golf Courses, two ski hills, a local airport, Carp Market, Mississippi River, an Elk farm, river beaches

name: Furnished Room in a Friendly Family Home
description: Discounted for longer term stay and suitable for a young/mature professional or student who is clean, tidy, quiet, responsible, independent, and friendly. This room includes all utilities and good WIFI. Private parking and free street parking, laundry: washer, kitchen, dining/living room, a large private backyard with a patio. The home has a friendly family environment in a very safe and secure neighborhood and conveniently located to shopping, public transit, parks, and highway access.
neighborhood_overview: Convenient to public transit and parks. Shopping and restaurants nearby. Free parking on location.
host_about: Janice is a semi retired arts and culture educator and Garry has a background in Emergency Management and Municipal Government. The historic Gothic stone church is a family homestead that has been lovingly restored over many years. They enjoy travelling with their children around the world and showing them as much about the world as possible, connecting them to its people, nature, architecture, culture, food and art.  They believe each day holds adventures and lessons. They appreciate and value sharing their home, their knowledge and their time to help enrich the lives of those they meet. They love the outdoors, sports, music, films, and cooking together.  They are experienced hosts and have a long history with acting as host family to those new to the country and to their community. They enjoy promoting local culture, businesses, the arts and sharing tips about their Town with others so they can feel like a 'Local'.  Sharing brings people around the world closer and they appreciate the friendships they make from their travels as well as from those they've had the privilege of hosting.

name: Modern Pristine 3BD w Parking
description: Clean, modern, newly renovated home in quiet Westboro/Hintonburg. Open concept Living/Dining Room, high ceilings, wonderful eat-in kitchen, beautiful back garden w/ deck & outdoor furniture. Upstairs patio off of master bedroom. New appliances & fully stocked kitchen. Walking distance to Civic Hospital, Parkdale Market, Wellington Village. 3min walk to shops, restaurants, bus stops. 10min walk to Ottawa River Parkway. 8km to downtown (15min direct bus ride/7 min drive).
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to Civic Hospital, Parkdale Market and Wellington Village. 3 min walk to shops, restaurants, outdoor market, bus stops & 10min walk to Ottawa River Parkway. 9km from downtown (15min direct bus ride or 7 min drive). Quiet area with lots to do. Friendly neighbours and a short walk to coffee shops, Parkdale market and the Parkway to stroll along the water or watch the sunset or take a bike ride along the paths. Grocery store, liquor store, beer store in the area. 2min walk to several different bus stops. Easy Queensway (hwy 417) access, 1min by car.

Hintonburg/Wellington West area is a trendy and safe place with lots of great restaurants and shopping. The nearly three-kilometre stretch along Wellington Street West – from Ottawa’s LRT line (called the O-Train) to Island Park Drive (an elegant stretch of homes) – is about 10 minutes west of Parliament Hill.

Its eastern border is the O-Train Trillium Line, just west of Preston Street, with Centretown W
host_about:
I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I have been an Airbnb host now for over 9 years. I love interacting with my guests and ensuring they're happy in their space. 

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.

name: Centrally located 3 bedroom home in Westboro!
description: For the summer of 2020 I will only be accepting a minimum one month rental starting June 4th. Vintage inspired bungalow home located in Westboro Beach area for rent. This home comfortably accommodates up to 6 people. Located steps away from all the shops, best restaurants in the city, bike path and beach. Funky home for family or friends to share. Pet friendly.  Parking for two cars. Close to Tunney's Pasture, Civic Hospital and a 10 minute bus ride to downtown!
neighborhood_overview: Westboro has some of the best restaurants in the city! You could dine out every night during your stay or cook at home. Richmond Road has many outdoor shops, cafes, boutiques , gift shops, food retailers etc. During the summer go for a swim in the evening right behind my home at Kitschissippi beach! The bike path along the parkway offers safe biking to downtown within 30 minutes.
host_about: I've decided to open my home in Ottawa to fellow travellers! I'm new to Airbnb and open to suggestions. I've traveled on my own to India, Europe, USA, sailed in the Grenadine Islands, South America. I love Ottawa and have lived here most of my life. I own a business in the city and would gladly help you find the right place to shop, eat, visit etc.

name: Mer Bleue Private Apartment
description: A modern, renovated, fully equipped and luxurious one bedroom apartment in the country side of Ottawa but close to all amenities. Big backyard! Only a 15-20 min drive from downtown Ottawa, here you will find peace and quiet,  full privacy, a home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
If you are looking for privacy and the feeling of a secluded hideaway yet want to be close to all the amenities, you have found your haven! The Mer Bleue Apartment offers a country setting with a lot of land (1.5 acres) yet is only a short bicycle ride away from the heart of Orleans.

The house is located near the Mer Bleue bog, a 3,500-hectare NCC conservation area that has a northern eco-system more typical of the Arctic.
(website hidden)

There is also a large NCC trail network a short walk away that is perfect for walking, jogging, running, skiing, bicycling with beautiful nature scenery and wildlife.
host_about: Welcome to my profile!  I am an easygoing, fun loving professional that enjoys socializing as well as her quiet time.  My career is in IT.   I love real estate and have many renovation projects on the go so I am quite busy.  I love to travel and to talk to others about their travels and hobbies.  I am passionate about Cuba and I feel it is my second home.  I always want the best experience and accommodation for my guests and I pay great attention to details and quality so that you can relax and enjoy your stay.  I look forward to meeting you but if our schedules don't match then I wish you the best of stay and hope you feel at home here at the Mer Bleue Apartment.  All the best in your travels!!

name: Bright Modern & Spacious - Executive Rental
description: Spacious, private, well-appointed, executive rental with ample parking, unlimited high speed, open concept kitchen and high efficiency washer & dryer. Ideally suited to single professionals or couples seeking a convenient, comfortable home-away from home.  Just off of Ottawa's Highway 417, you're mere minutes to/from Downtown Ottawa, Kanata, Nepean, Westboro, Hintonburg, & Barrhaven. Check out our reviews and send us a message - timely responses assured!
neighborhood_overview:
Quaint, tree lined neighborhood steps away from unique restaurants, and shopping as well as immediate access to transit, the Ottawa River Parkway and Gatineau Park. Minutes away from fantastic neighborhoods including Westboro, Hintonburg, Kanata (Kanata Tech Centre and the Department of National Defense DND Campus), Nepean, Barrhaven (RCMP headquarters), Gatineau and Downtown Ottawa via the Ottawa River Parkway.

We are surrounded by ample green space, which includes fabulous hiking and cycling trails. As well, we are only minutes away from the Ottawa River Parkway which runs directly to center of the city winding its way alongside the Ottawa River. A perfect place to walk, run, jog or cycle.
host_about:
We’ve made every effort to make your stay in Ottawa a relaxing and enjoyable experience. Take comfort in the many years of positive reviews we’ve received as super hosts. 

Please don't hesitate to reach out. We’re happy to respond quickly to any questions you may have before booking.

description:
Renting out my beautiful 1 bedroom condo located in the heart of the Golden Triangle downtown Ottawa!
Located at Elgin and Somerset.

BRAND NEW BUILDING. 1 bed 1 bath condo for rent
FURNISHED everything included!
Open concept oversized balcony facing downtown!
Walking distance to Parliament Hill, Rideau Centre, Rideau Canal, grocery stores, cafes, parks!

Includes: Internet, flat screen TV, leather sofa, fully equipped kitchen, In Suite Laundry, washer, dryer, fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave.
host_about: I am an adventurous Canuck wanting to explore the world and have found AirBnb and it has opened my eyes to a whole new world!  I have travelled throughout Canada, Europe and South. I'd like to visit Asia and South America!

name: Charming Eurostyle apartment! PD2
description:
This charming and perfectly outfitted one bedroom is located in a trendy, urban, neighbourhood with a plethora of shops, fantastic restaurants, theatre, art galleries, food stores, parks, bicycling and walking paths and beaches nearby.

This property is only suitable for a single person or a couple. Children and pets are unsuited for this space.

This is the upper unit of a duplex/up & down unit. It is entirely private with its own entrance. Shared space is patio and driveway ONLY.
neighborhood_overview: This is the Ottawa neighbourhood to live in! This property has a walk score of 93 which is considered a "Walker's Paradise", a Transit Score of 86 which is considered "excellent", and a Bike Score of 100!.  Shops, restaurants, live  theatre starts with a short walk of two blocks away.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

name: Central Ottawa Micro Condo Studio w Heated Parking
description:
Centrally located micro condo (315 ft² or 29 m²) includes essential amenities Kitchenette (double burner cooktop only), Laundry, Double/Full bed (not a Queen), fully furnished, smart TV, full bath)

There's a reason the neighborhood is called "Centretown"
neighborhood_overview:
The location is great with shops, cafes, restaurants, museum, parliament etc. all within walking distance. The unit is on the 2nd floor next to a stairwell for easy street access at a side door exit and also has an elevator for your added convenience.

Convenient access to public transportation or taxi service otherwise most places are within walking distance

Whether you are in town for a month or more this place can be just what you are looking for.
host_about:
Adopted Ottawa as home in 2001 (previously Toronto native) and absolutely love this beautiful city.  I enjoy most sports generally but tennis takes precedence since my move to Ottawa.

In my private and professional life I travel extensively and through it developed a keen sense of what a guest prizes vs what puts us off.  Also listening to my own guests has been key to the continued success as some of them have provided excellent feedback on ways to improve which led to evolving my space to keep it fresh and maintain excellent value.  My main goal is to earn high marks on each of the metrics of the review system at AirBNB along with guest comments which in my view is the real value proposition of my offering.

I speak fluent Portuguese, some Spanish and Greek.

Thanks for checking my listing out :-)

name: 3 Bedroom Executive Apt in Westboro
description: Updated 3 bdrm/1.5 bath apartment, located right in the heart of trendy Westboro, a family friendly borough known for great stores and restaurants. Steps from transit line and close to bike paths makes this spot ideal for visiting Ottawa.
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a vibrant, family friendly community. Richmond Road is lined with many boutiques and better known stores, cafés, yoga studios, and restaurants. Be sure to check out the market Saturday mornings.

For those with children, there are several neighbourhood parks with fun structures, kiddie pool/splash pad within a few blocks. There are extensive trails along the Ottawa River and nearby Westboro Beach about a 10 minute walk away.

Also close by (walking distance):
- Gezellig is owned by a reputable restaurateur. It's nice because you can get any two plates for $28 at brunch/lunch. It has a modern, simple decor.
- Both PiCo and Fiazza are great take-out/eat-in pizza joints within a block
- The Works is a beloved Ottawa hamburger chain. It's known for its many topping selections (including peanut butter and macaroni - but not together). It has a neat atmosphere.
-Trio, with a boho atmosphere and delectable small plates.
- Newboro is a
host_about: We're from Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Michael works for the government in Canada's northern communities. As all good Canadian boys do, he loves hockey. His love of hockey almost rivals his love of live music, dancing, relaxing at the cottage and cooking. Alisha is a high school English teacher. She loves working with youth, finds they keep her honest, and enjoys their exuberance. Michael's great cooking and tolerance of Alisha's ever-growing-library make up for the many hours he spends drafting for his fantasy league in the summer and glued to the screen in the fall-winter-spring. Together, they love to travel and hope to do more of it in the future.

name: Chic 1 Bedroom in Beechwood Village (Suite 1)
description: Beautifully furnished, private ground-floor accommodation in a lovely and well-maintained home on quiet Vachon Avenue. Walking distance to an upscale and vibrant community with every amenity close by. Lovingly renovated, this bright suite feels like an upscale condo, with modern furnishings and tons of function. A shared yard is available for barbecues or bicycle storage. Brushing the east side of Ottawa, this central location puts you within 15 minutes of whereever you want to go.
neighborhood_overview: Bordering New Edinburgh and Rockcliffe Park, Beechwood Village is a charming neighborhood with many national landmarks. From the grounds of the Governor General's residence at Rideau Hall, to beautiful Beechwood Cemetery there is a wide choice of places to visit on bike or on foot. The peaceful paths of the Ottawa river are nearby and the vibrant Byward Market is only a short ride over the St. Patrick Street bridge. Village Suites is walking distance to the shops of Beechwood Avenue where good coffee, fresh flowers, warm bread or a bus stop are at your fingertips.
host_about:
Hello. I am a real estate investor in Ottawa, which is a tremendous place to visit. I enjoy hosting through AirBNB and sharing the fun of being in the capital city. The reason Village Suites came to be was to provide people with the kind of accommodation that I would like to stay in; clean, stylish with a place for everything and everything in its place. Having traveled extensively through work and also with my family, I really appreciate having the "right" place to stay. Our locations are in safe, walkable neighborhoods with every convenience at your fingertips. This account was previously managed by my husband Dave, so you will see his name in a lot of the historical reviews. We didn't want to start a new account and lose all the good press!

Please send me a message if I can answer any questions for you while you are planning your stay in Ottawa. - Jane

name: Explore The Glebe from a Scenic Loft/Apartment
description:
Lean back on a leather chaise sofa and be submerged in daylight from a set of corner windows in this hip apartment. Fix a cup of coffee in a warm kitchen, walk across light wood floors, and step out onto the balcony for fresh air and lovely views.

Amazing views of the Canal, Bank Street bridge, Lansdowne Park and Old Ottawa South. Bright, modern condo with extra space created with a 'murphy bed' style bedroom, stylishly camouflaged. Cool kitchen & custom table to people watch on the street below, coffee in hand. Equipped with apple tv. in cozy lvng rm area, sorry no cable, hate commercials. The balcony is a sweet place to sit and enjoy a moment with a great view of the neighbourhood.

Full access. The building itself has no amenities inside. No laundry services available on site.

If you have any questions feel free to get in touch with either myself or my co hosts Phil and Mark via text or phone call.

The apartment is located beside Lansdowne
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located beside Lansdowne Park, facing the Canal and Bank Street Bridge. It sits between Old Ottawa South and The Glebe, surrounded by idyllic homes, quiet streets, parks, and ponds. Restaurants, shops, and bars are just steps away.
host_about: I was born and raised in Ottawa and attended university in Halifax. I developed an interest in travelling from a young age and have been chipping away at the globe ever since. I worked for many years as a restaurant owner with a few places in town. I escaped (just pre pandemic) in order to spend more time adventuring. I still bartend and consult for restaurants in the city.

name: Gorgeous, Large 3 Bed Downtown with Parking
description: Your oasis nestled in the city. Bright, modern open-concept living. 3 Bedroom, 2 balcony, 1.5 bath. Hardwood floors throughout, fully stocked kitchen with a gas stove, dishwasher, coffee maker, microwave, blender, toaster oven & cookware. Condo is approximately 1300 square feet with large living room sitting area & 3 large bedrooms. Close to everything. Walk to the Byward Market, Parliament, the Canal & more. Great location in the heart of beautiful Ottawa. Long term stays are welcome.
neighborhood_overview:
If you’re looking to live in the heart of downtown Ottawa, Centretown is the place to be. Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

Centretown’s history is naturally intertwined with the history of Ottawa, and you can see that history anywhere you look. Just north of the “official” boundaries of Centretown are the Parliament Buildings of Canada, the famous Chateau Laurier, the former Ottawa central train station, and historic Sparks St. West of Elgin, you’ll find many of the bank and financial towers that keep the city’s economy moving forward.

As you head further south, the character gradually changes

name: This cozy one bedroom in-law suite
description:
This cozy one bedroom in-law suite (in owners home) is located in Ottawa's new "it" neighbourhood (says the Globe and Mail March 2016). Trendy Wellington West is situated between Westboro and Hintonburg.
Ideal for visitors to the city or for anyone on course at Tunney's Pasture or Civic Hospital.
neighborhood_overview:
Wellington West is an artsy, historic neighbourhood in the heart of Ottawa. The neighbourhood is home to a huge number of acclaimed restaurants (over 88 according to Urban Spoon) including Supply and Demand, voted Canada's 4th best restaurant by enRoute magazine last year and Soca Kitchen and Pub, great article in Porter Airlines magazine recently.

This fun neighbourhood is changing and growing up, so you'll find traditional diners and an "old school" bowling lane cozying up to several gourmet restaurants, a microbrewery, SuzyQ gourmet donuts...(heaven sent!) independent cafes, bars and local designers' shops. You can stroll through Wellington West or Hintonburg on your way to Westboro, Little Italy, Chinatown, or down to the scenic Ottawa Parkway and Ottawa river bike/walking path.
It is a 10-minute cab ride to Parliament Hill, the Byward Market and all the downtown attractions. Herb and Spice, a natural food store/grocery, is a five minute walk and Metro grocery stor
host_about:
I have travelled extensively and have lived in several different countries.  I love meeting new people and sharing their cultures.  I favour a couple of places and return every occasion I can: France, Ireland and Mexico.  

I can't live without my husband, my kids friends, knitting, warm weather!!  

I have been a guest several times with Airbnb but have only just started hosting.  I look forward to seeing how this works on the other side.  I know what I liked and disliked in the places I have stayed and so I hope to make our place as comfortable as possible for our guests.  I welcome feedback on how we can improve.  

My Motto is: Life is too short to spend it all working and so enjoy life to the fullest and see the world while you can!

name: Comfy mini-suite, great location.
description: Longer-term stays for working adults,  academics,  PhDs.  Sorry, no undergraduate students. Full 4-mo academic term only for fall 2024. Historic central Glebe neighbourhood. Quiet location near main shopping street.  10-minute walk to Carleton U.,  TDPlace/Lansdowne,  the Canal and more. Bus to Ottawa U. Quality, comfort, convenience.  Popular home share. Guests must have Covid vaccine. Send an INQUIRY with your details, NOT a reservation request please. Read more important info below.
neighborhood_overview:
The Glebe is a desirable central neighbourhood with big trees and lovely old brick homes, safe residential streets, just one neighbourhood out from the downtown core. There is quick easy access to all that Ottawa offers.
The Lansdowne complex is minutes away. It has the sports stadium, a Cineplex movie theatre, two condo towers, shops including a Whole Foods Market, a park, and an outdoor concert area, restaurants, the Farmer's Market and more.
The World Heritage Site canal, with its bike/jogging/walking paths and green spaces, surrounds the neighbourhood on three sides. The house is a few minutes walk from the Canal.
The neighbourhood has a lively mix of residents including university students, seniors, families, and professional singles. People come from all over the city on the weekends to enjoy the pedestrian environment on Bank St. and events at Lansdowne.
You can also walk to Dow's Lake from my house - it's about three blocks. This is where the tulip fest
host_about: I'm an active, outgoing, friendly, retired professional. I have three grown daughters and five grandkids. I love to travel. I've been to South East Asia four times, India twice, Japan, northern Europe, and several great cities in the USA. I always travel independently or with a friend. This modern, fresh, and cozy accommodation is located East Central of the Nation's Capital in a friendly neighbourhood.

The suite has independent entry and free parking on premises. It has a comfortable queen bed suitable for one or two persons. This non-smoking basement suite only a short stroll from all amenities, bike paths, and all of the downtown landmarks.

Peloton House is a stunning apartment on the upper two floors of a lovingly renovated historic 1867 build full of period charm.

The house is near the Governor General's residence in New Edinburgh, a central, old-world Heritage Conservation District. A longer walk will reach the Byward market and the National Gallery. We are located just off a bicycle path, as well as very easy access to the Gatineau park and its world-class hiking, cycling, swiming, skiing, mountain and fat biking trails.

Web are located just off a bicycle path that is interconnected to a number of paths leading through the city, as well as very easy access to the Gatineau park and its world-class hiking, cycling, swiming, skiing, mountain and fat biking trails.
host_about: Loves winter and loves Mexico.  A first generation Canadian with two Mexican rescue dogs and one Mexican spouse for a family that is 75% Mexican. As a human being, I value compassion and community.

name: Spacious room with ensuite. Central location.
description: Perfect for longer stays. Single working adults, post-docs, interns. Spacious & stylish. Comfort, quality, convenience. Great central location in trendy historic Glebe. Quiet location near main shopping street. Walk to Carleton U., TDPlace/Lansdowne, Dow's Lake, the Canal and more. Popular home share. Me and two guests only in the house. Sorry, no undergraduate students. Send an INQUIRY with your details, NOT a reservation request. For more important info, read below.
neighborhood_overview: "The Glebe" is one of Ottawa's most popular trendy neighbourhoods.  It is one neighbourhood out from the central core and is surrounded by the curve of the Rideau Canal. It has old brick houses and big trees with lots of different architecture, old and new. Our "main street" is an eight block section of Bank Street - Ottawa's main retail road that bisects the city and ends at Parliament Hill. On Bank Street ( a few minutes from my house) you will find many great restaurants, pubs and cafes, as well as unique small shops that attract people from all over the city. There are three grocery stores.  The big Lansdowne complex has the sports stadium, a Whole Foods, retail shopping, the weekend Farmer's Market, many eateries with outdoor patios, a big park, and a Cineplex. It's very lively, especially when there is a game or event on.  The Glebe is also adjacent to Dow's Lake (3 blocks from my house) where the Tulip Festival and Winterlude are held. You can walk to the Italian district, and a
host_about: I'm an active, outgoing, friendly, retired professional. I have three grown daughters and five grandkids. I love to travel. I've been to South East Asia four times, India twice, Japan, northern Europe, and several great cities in the USA. I always travel independently or with a friend. At home I love to garden, hike, kayak, snowshoe in the winter, cook, read,  work on house reno projects and spend time with friends and family .  I grew up in Toronto  but I've lived in Ottawa 45 years. I walk everyday for errands in my pedestrian neighbourhood. I enjoy people and am very happy when guests have a great time at my place.

name: Homestay  w/bed & desk in ByWard near uOttawa! (r)
description: Perfect student accommodation! Welcome to our lovely renovated home located in the quiet residential area of the ByWard Market.  We are a short walk to uOttawa, easy bus ride to Carleton University, UQO and UNAM. We offer three rooms to our guests, in a homestay environment, with a double bed in a private room.  Our house is home to three students, your hosts and a friendly dog -- all year long!  Linens and towels supplied.  Fully furnished. Ideal 'family stay' for students.  Read our reviews!
neighborhood_overview: The ByWard Market area is the oldest part of our city.  Before Ottawa was declared the capital, it was a rough lumber town known as Bytown, and was not much larger than the ByWard area.  By the time Canada became a country in 1867, Ottawa had expanded and added the government buildings you will see today -- our neighbourhood remains as a reminder of the modest beginnings Canada enjoyed.
host_about: Geoff and I have lived in our heritage home for 30 years.  Now with our children grown and gone we love to keep our extra rooms full with guests from all over the world.  We live right in the centre of the city but yet in a quiet residential area.  You can walk to all the major attractions in the city as well as uOttawa, many embassies and if you like nightlife, just blocks away.  We have a precocious little Welsh Terrier, Wally, who really runs our house!  If you are looking for a family home in the heart of things then we are the place for you.  Meals are included for our long term guests but can also be provided for an extra fee to short term guests.

name: Comfy Stay for Med Students, Residents & Fellows
description:
Welcome, medical professionals to a comfy stay for medical students, residents and fellows in our charming, renovated, wartime house. Our home is reserved exclusively for those completing placements at the Civic Hospital / Ottawa Heart Institute situated a 12-15 minute walk away.

The house is shared with potentially another medical professional in the room across from yours along with Terry and I. More than just a rental, this is your home away from home. We look forward to hosting you!
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a wonderful neighbourhood with friendly neighbours. In the nearby Westgate Shopping Centre there is:
- 24/7 Shoppers Drug Mart for convenience supplies including food
- TD bank
- Health food store

10 minute walk away is Hampton Park Plaza with:
- Food Basics grocery store (we have re-usable bags for you to use)
- Drug Store
- Liquor Store
- Cannabis Store

Within a 30 minute walk you have the hot neighbourhoods of Westboro, Hintonburg and Preston Street - enough restaurants and shops to keep you very busy!

After a hosting hiatus during the pandemic, we are back!

Wendy is a professional artist and you will see her paintings on display around the house. It's like living in an art gallery! 

We enjoy meeting and having conversations with people from all around the world.

name: Super Cozy Central TopDuplex@Market
description: Welcome to the cozy comforts & character of a century-old house with a shared main entrance & private entrance to your top floor which includes a queen bed and windows everywhere! Fully equipped kitchen, and well furnished dining and living room with leather sofa. A home in Ottawa, close to everything: Byward Market, Parliament, Museums, Canal, Foreign Affairs & more... Welcome to skiers & cyclists w/wo bikes as we are also cyclist/ski enthusiasts!
neighborhood_overview:
You will be in Lowertown, Ottawa's oldest neighbourhood, which also includes the ByWard Market. The "Urban Renewal" project has eroded Lowertown's heritage, but Clarence Street (formerly Franklin) and York Street east of King Edward have largely preserved their heritage. Among our block houses, the only house that has kept its stables (as horses were the main means of transport) is the red brick house with a triangular roof just east of King Edward. The houses in the neighbourhood generally date from the late 1890s, when Ottawa was a timber processing and logging city.

Clarence Street begins with the American Embassy in the west (at the market) and continues to the Rideau River in the east. Clarence intersects King Edward Boulevard, formerly a boulevard with trees and benches in the middle of its peninsula. Unlike the pre-urban era of urban renewal when Clarence / Franklin was a busy street, this is no longer the case outside the market area. East of King Edward, Clarence w
host_about:
Hi there socially-astute traveller!

As a host, I look forward to making your short (or perhaps longer) stay in Ottawa a most delicious, amazing and memorable one!

May your travels see you discover plenty!

Welcome to 277 a few blocks to the Byward Market heart of Ottawa!

Alex

name: Downtown farmhouse w parking
description: Quiet apartment in 2nd floor of original farmhouse, with windows facing all 4 cardinal directions.  Located 2 blocks from the historic Rideau Canal and walking distance to the Parliament Buildings, ByWard Market, restaurants, groceries, LCBO, theaters, National Arts Center, bike paths, Museums, Hospital, Universities, Cordon Bleu. neighborhood_overview: Any direction you walk leads to interesting sites. Walk or cycle South along the picturesque historic Rideau Canal to reach Ottawa Lansdowne Park where you can attend professional sporting events, take in a movie or enjoy shopping, coffee and restaurants; in the adjacent Glebe neighborhood you will find a strip of boutiques. Further along the canal you will reach Carleton University and the Hogs Back Lock Station set in beautiful natural surroundings. In the opposite direction on Elgin Street, you will come upon many restaurants, the Museum of Nature, the Ottawa Courthouse, the National Arts Centre, the National War Memorial monument, the Parliament Buildings, and adjacent Supreme Court.  East from this location you will find the ByWard Market, National Gallery and many more site seeing, shopping, and eating opportunities.
host_about: I am a violinist, my husband works at Algonquin College.  We have been renovating this house throughout our 30 year marriage while raising 3 children.  We love to cook, garden, socialize and visit family in Italy and Holland.

name: Ottawa house monthly
description:
Enjoy the beauty and quiet of the countryside in the middle of the city.
Single storey, upper end newly renovated bungalow fully furnished and fully equipped. Right in Kanata's high tech area and easy access to the highway. Beautiful park setting neighbourhood. Quiet and convenient location with restaurants, shopping and entertainment. Private, separate entrance.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Canada's national Capital region.
Kanata is the silicon valley of the North - the Kanata High Tech sector is our neighbour. If you are a business traveller and require convenient accommodation in the heart of the Kanata's high tech sector, stay in this beautiful private house and get to your workplace and after hour amenities in mere minutes.
Come enjoy all that the city of Ottawa has to offer. Our city has festivals year round - Music, Food, Culture, Art and outdoor activities. We have Winterlude and the Rideau Canal skate-way. We have the Tulip festival and we have the National capital marathon. Our sports venues are some of the best in the world - we have NHL Hockey, CFL Football, Fury Soccer and world class Equestrian at Wesley Clover Parks, just to name a few.
The neighbourhood is primarily residential but close to shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It is a fully planned community - walking trails are plenty, natural forest areas have been preserved

name: CoHabit w/young professionals Ottawa ED 3
description:
Co-Habit Erindale – Great location, quiet neighbourhood, west of downtown, private and secure guestroom! This property is best suited for guests between the ages of 25-38. Co-ed. Accommodates 4 young professionals in 1800 sq feet.

Single accommodation only.

Large comfortable property with highspeed internet, and lovely backyard with deck and plenty of space for working from home. Although a shared property we are limiting the number of guests during 2020. Please message us for details.
neighborhood_overview: Great, quiet, safe, mature residential neighbourhood within walking distance to amenities, good public transit to downtown, Centretown, West or East Ottawa.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

Private room with a single bed in a renovated heritage home in the ByWard Market area. Enjoy a home-stay environment, well located to universities, attractions and services. Perfect for students. Furnished, and linens supplied.

Our reviews tell the story -- make the most of your Ottawa visit!

Walk to uOttawa, easy access to Carleton, St Joseph's, UQO, UNAM.

name: Oasis in the middle of the City
description:
This 1939 bungalow is still very much in its original, slightly quirky form, with interesting colours and textures and funky doors, windows & switchplates.

This "Old Ottawa" neighbourhood is fantastic for walking and shopping and dining. We are a ten minute walk from The Green Door - Ottawa's most famous vegetarian restaurant.

A super-quiet neighbourhood , and yet you are mere minutes from the canal, the Rideau river, the Glebe ... and much more.
neighborhood_overview:
Convenient to many of the key tourist areas. These destinations are all walkable - or even faster - a brief bike ride along one of Ottawa’s famous bike baths. No need to deal with traffic to get to:

- Elgin Street: major bar and restaurant hot-spot
- The Glebe: unique old neighbourhood, locally-owned shops full of treasures
- The TD Center: our major stadium for Football, soccer etc
- The Rideau Canal: Right at the end of my street!
- The Rideau River: perfect for walks in nature
- Ottawa University: a short distance along the canal
- Carleton University: a short distance in the opposite direction
- CHEO: Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario

description:
Welcome to Bay Side!

Private extra large 1 bedroom apartment with full size kitchen situated in a mature neighborhood downtown Ottawa. The bike path is directly situated in front of the home. Located within less of a 30 min walking distance to the canal, museums, government buildings, shops, restaurants and grocery stores. neighborhood_overview:
Centertown is a widely sought after location for tourists or professionals wanting to be close to everything the city of Ottawa has to offer.
Small businesses shops, restaurants, entertainment and Parliament Hill are all within a 30 min or less walking distance. You will enjoy walking to the various shops and boutiques, the newly renovated Cadillac Fairview Rideau Shopping Center and the newly redesigned Lansdowne Park which includes the TD Place stadium are sure to meet all of your shopping needs. We are 10min walk away from Chinatown and 15min from Little Italy they are both popular areas for restaurants. Bank and Elgin St. have hip bars / restaurants / pubs.
There are a few museums located within walking distance such as the Museum of Nature, Museum of History, Museum of Agriculture, the National Gallery of Canada, etc. There are plenty of biking trails in Ottawa which can also take you to other areas such as the Gatineau Hills which are part of the Outaouais region. neighborhood_overview:
Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a residential area located in East Ottawa, Canada. This is a relatively quiet and peaceful community, consisting mostly of single-family homes and townhouses.

The neighborhood is bordered by Boulevard St. Laurent to the west, the Air Force Park to the east, the Ogilvie road to the north and the Queensway highway to the south. It is located close to several amenities, including shopping malls, restaurants, parks and schools.

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is also well connected by public transit, with several bus lines through the area, offering easy access to other parts of the city. It is a diverse neighborhood with a mix of residents of different cultural backgrounds. Overall, Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a family-friendly neighborhood that offers a comfortable and convenient lifestyle.
host_about:

name: Co-habit w/young professionals Ottawa  ED 1
description: Erindale is located in Ottawa Centre/West close to  RCMP, Health Canada at Riverside, Riverside Drive, Baseline Road, Algonquin College, College Square.  The property is 1,800 sq ft shared between 4  professionals in rooms with door locks.  Two bathrooms (shared), a completely equipped kitchen, two fridges, bed and bath linens, lovely decor and furnishings, an on site washer and dryer, backyard deck with eating space and sun loungers, parking, and winter snow removal and summer landscaping.
neighborhood_overview: This is a mature, residential neighbourhood located in Central/West Ottawa. It is close to bike paths that travel throughout the City of Ottawa. It is approximately 30 minutes to Westboro/Wellington Village & Little Italy, and 45 minutes to downtown Ottawa along the lovely Rideau Canal.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

name: Private and Cozy Welcome to Bullfrog cottage!
description:
An Ottawa gem.
25 mins from downtown 10 mins to Orleans.
Located in the safe exclusive area of lush and leafy Navan.
Relaxing space and uncomplicated living.
We like it that way and hope you do too?
Close to walking trails, vineyards, a cafe, and The Navan farmers market.
Starry skys on clear nights! lovely!
Parking
Wi Fi
Your pet is welcome when requested... reasonable conditions apply.
Stay 31+ nights for significant savings!
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is in a rural area . The area has a a mixture of farms and single homes .

If you have wanted a retreat to simple living but still enjoying wi fi and other necessary's our cozy space is waiting to welcome you.

Navan enjoys a substantial amount of green-space. Historically a rural farming community, the village enjoys an enviable community spirit.

GROCERIES, SHOPPING AND DINING OUT.
The Original Navan market monthly may through November is a delight!
Roadside vegetable /fruit markets operate in the area daily throughout the summer. ( One right opposite Western beef. The meat lovers jewel of Navan!)
A very short drive will bring you to an abundance of grocery stores and family restaurants.
2mins-1.5km J.T. Bradley’s country convenience store.
Navan Market begins late spring through summer into fall.
Country moments Caffe 1.5km.
3mins-3km Seasonal roadside produce; fresh, mostly locally grown, vege

name: Boutique Suite in Ottawa's West End
description:
Whether you are a professional coming to Ottawa for work, retired or just looking to explore the city, the Boutique Suite is the perfect place to stay.

Our Boutique Suite comes with all amenities (like a Nespresso machine), fast and reliable WiFi, a full bathroom, and a washer/dryer.

name: Entire Executive Townhome-Ottawa
description:
Welcome to our 2 bedroom Executive townhome nestled in Avalon Encore.

Our place is close to:
- 15 mins drive to downtown
- 2 mins drive to Barley Mow, other restaurants and strip of stores
- 5 mins drive to Place d'Orléans shopping mall
- 10 mins drive to Petrie Island Beach
- 39 mins drive to Calypso Theme Waterpark

Our place is good for families, solo adventurers and business travellers.
neighborhood_overview:
Guest will enjoy the largest park in the Avalon area.

Henri-Rocque Park is a minute walk from the home. It has a summer splash pad, a shade and play structures. The neighborhood has a scenic pond /trail.

Don Boudria Park features a baseball diamond, a multi-purpose court for year-round sports, a shade structure, games tables, etc.

Guest will enjoy the ease and convenience of being within walking distance of Orléans' amenities. This includes shopping centres along Innes Road, featuring your favourite big-box stores like Winners, Lowes, Walmart and more. There are plenty of grocery stores, as well as great local restaurants.

**Wondering about safety of the neighbourhood?
The building is very safe and has a 24hr security guard like a high end luxury hotel. The building is located right in the heart of downtown and it is a very touristy area. It is recommended to always exercise adequate discretion like when travelling downtown in any metropolitan city. According to Statistics Canada, Ottawa has one of the lowest crime rates in Canada for a metropolitan area. Ottawa crime rates are well below Montreal, Toronto, Vancouver, Edmonton, Guelph, Kingston, St. John, and many others.

name: Colorful Apartment in an Urban Courtyard near ByWard Market
description:
Over-looking our private courtyard located at the back of our building are two open-concept rental spaces. Bright and cozy with a charming mix of modern and antique decor, they can be rented individually or together to accommodate a larger group. The front of the building houses Parlour, our AVEDA Concept Hair Salon.

This listing is for Suite #5, our two-story open-concept apartment. The living room, fully equipped kitchen and a small 2 piece washroom with laundry machines occupy the ground floor. The pull-out couch in the living room opens up to make a queen sized bed.

The bedroom space and a large 3-piece washroom are located on the top floor, an open-concept modern mezzanine with glass walls. Customizable rolling blinds can be adjusted for your comfort and privacy.

You will have full access to Suite # 5 with a 24hr keyless entry. The suite overlooks our private courtyard which is occasionally shared with other guests.

I do not live on
neighborhood_overview: The ByWard Market is a vibrant and tourist-friendly historic neighborhood featuring Ottawa's top shops, patios, and restaurants. Parliament Hill, the National Art Gallery, and the National Arts Centre are walking distance from the suite.
host_about: In 1984 I established my successful business, Parlour Hair Salon, in a beautiful heritage property in the core of Ottawa ByWard Market. In my travels I have been very happy to use AirBnB and recently decided to renovate two luxurious suites of my own. name: Elcho's Explore Ottawa Luxury for 6 - Parking
description:
Close to Ottawa downtown. The unit is fully equipped, quiet on the 2nd floor duplex of our home.
Kitchen with choice of Bodem Press or Krueger coffee maker, pots, pans, fridge, stove and microwave. Sleeps 6. Parking, "Embassy row", view of Ottawa river, Strathcona Park, 15 mins. walk/1 bus: Byward Mkt, Rideau & Sparks St, Parliament, Hill, Canal, City Hall, Sites.
Parking: One parking spot in driveway at $10/night, $50 flat fee for 5-day+ stay.

*We are Travel Proud hosts.
neighborhood_overview:
Look for the identifying plaques on the heritage buildings throughout Sandy Hill. Range Rd., (Embassy Row) is lined with embassies two of which are our neighbors in the back. Pack a picnic and walk 4 minutes to Strathcona Park where children can be seen playing in its sand castle and swings. In the winter you might catch a glimpse of a cross country skier or two. While at the park, stroll along the Ottawa River, home of ducks and two swans, or walk to the park's entrance on Laurier Avenue and make a wish at the fountain. There are more embassies on Laurier but almost directly across the street is the famous Cordon Bleu Culinary Institute. You will need to make advance reservations for lunch or dinner there. BTW: The stop light that is around the corner from the Russian Embassy is Rideau St. which becomes Wellington St. (Direction West...i.e. left turn), address of the Senate & Parliament, Library & Archives and the Bank of Canada.
At the far end of the park you can cross Ottaw
host_about:
My Mom was the quintessential home maker and host. I learned hosting at her feet in Canada, in the Bahamas, and in Jamaica. I have been hosting friends and family from as far back as high school and college. Yes. Mine was the apartment where friends timed "just dropping in" knowing full well that food, a warm bed, or a respite was always there.  
I'm also a connector/networker and a go-to person who loves people,  travelling, cooking, gardening, interior decorating as well as domestic science. Along with my business degree and over 30 years runnung a Canada-wide financial services brokerage, I've found a perfect fit in accommodations both in Canada and in Jamaica.
I'm also a mom and step-mom of a total of  of 5 Gen-X & Gen-Y, and a grandmother of 6, Daniel's wife, a former financial advisor and financial columnist, a gardening blogger, a socialite, a fashion stylist, a Mistress of Ceremony and a writer. I can manage in French and can count in Spanish...high school Spanish.
Please join me in explOring my little slice of heaven. See you soon.
Cheers!

Over-looking our private courtyard are two open-concept rental spaces. Bright and cozy with a charming mix of modern and antique decor, they can be rented individually or together to accommodate a larger group. The front of the building houses Parlour, our AVEDA Concept Hair Salon.

This listing is for Suite #4, a cozy ground floor open-concept apartment. Warm and welcoming, it has everything you need for a comfortable stay. The compact yet fully loaded kitchen includes a dishwasher and has all the basic dishes & utensils for creating meals. The pull-out couch in the living room opens up to make a queen sized bed. Laundry machines are tucked away in one of the closets in the bedroom space. A wall of windows separates the living area and bedroom space, equipped with a curtain for privacy. Customizable rolling blinds in the living area can be adjusted for your comfort and privacy.

You will have full private access to Suite # 4 with a 24hr keybox entry. The suite ov
neighborhood_overview: The ByWard Market is a vibrant area with many great shops, seasonal patios, and restaurants. Local fruit and vegetable vendors set up all summer long, and during the winter season, skate down the Rideau Canal, the world's largest skating rink.
host_about: In 1984 I established my successful business, Parlour Hair Salon, in a beautiful heritage property in the core of Ottawa ByWard Market. In my travels I have been very happy to use AirBnB and recently decided to renovate two luxurious suites of my own. I have now created Spatzio Rental Suites in the back courtyard of my property and am excited to start welcoming guests.  I love spending time with my family, travelling, gardening and appreciate good food. I look forward to providing an elegant and comfortable experience for travellers discovering our beautiful city.

description: 8 Hartington Place is a unique 3 bedroom 1800 square ft. rebuilt 120 year-old Victorian Home in the Heart of the Golden Triangle equipped with its own gated parking spot and all the amenities that spell luxury & prestige. Decorated with original art and top quality beds, linens, towels, furniture you enter a place of luxury and comfort you can call home. Our home is 2 blocks from  Rideau Canal and 4 Bl. from Parliament Hill. It's available - in the heart of the entertainment district. Sleeps 8
neighborhood_overview: What is unique about the Golden Triangle is that in this downtown core you have a village feel. You are safe and surrounded by professionals and people that call this area their home but yet just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the entertainment district. You may not ever drive your car and leave this fully contained location. Everything you need is a stones throw away. Since this is the downtown close to parliament hill, the city has spent literally $1 billion in creating proper sidewalks, restoring historical buildings and dotting the area with fountains and sculptures, Fabulous upscale restaurants mixed with farmers markets, live music venues and great bars line the street. Also Coffee shops are just all a few blocks away... also walk to your Yoga studio - Bike path a few blocks away by the Canal and Byward Market a 5 min. bike ride.... City Hall and Parliament hill a 5 min. bike ride.... you’re in the hub of what’s called the Golden triangle. This is a remarkable loca
host_about:
Honest, hard working, fair, kind, generous, positive thinker.
Favorite places to travel: Europe, Asia, North America, all beach areas in the world and wildlife preserves. My favorite cities include: New York, Rome, Athens, Paris, Cannes, San Tropez,Madrid, Helsinki, Warsaw, , Jamaica, Chiang Mai, Tibet, Kalamata, ( Greece)Castro,(Italy) Genova, San Diego, Montreal.Love and Kindness is all that is worth it. name: Private, quiet, clean apartment
description: My place is 3 km from downtown - an average of 10 minutes away by car, and 15 minutes by bus. It is conveniently located for central destinations such as the Byward Market, national museums, National Gallery, National Arts Centre, Parliament Hill, and Rideau Canal, and many amenities such as recreational pathways, main streets, supermarkets, etc., and to venues for many of Ottawa's 33 festivals, including Winterlude, Tulip Festival, and the Blues Fest.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is a well-established French Canadian part of Ottawa. Rockcliffe and the Ottawa River are a short distance to the north and the Rideau River is just to the west. There is a lovely pathway along the east side of the Rideau River which runs for 10 km south to the Hog's Back Falls Park and 3 km north to where the Rideau River drops over a 9-metre cliff into the Ottawa River. There are some good views of Downtown Ottawa from the falls. 13 minutes' walk to the north of my home is Richelieu Park, which is home to urban Ottawa's last surviving sugar bush where over 1,000 maple trees are tapped. It's the only urban sugar bush in North America. The dates for the Maple Sugar Fest at the the Vanier Sugar Shack can be found the city's website.

This community is very fortunate in having the Rideau River as a barrier between it and downtown! Roads with commuter traffic completely bypass it. This makes it a best-of-both-worlds place - very quiet and neighbourly but wit
host_about: I am pretty good at responding to guests' and would-be guests' enquiries except when I am travelling. I enjoy camping and travelling in remote locations such as in the wilds of Central America where WiFi is either very limited or completely unavailable. I do try to have a family member check my Airbnb messages so that people who contact me to ask questions or to make a reservation can be informed that I am away and of the date of my return., and their booking requests can also be accepted. Almost inevitably, there can be delays so please be patient!  Many thanks for your understanding.

name: Clean & Modern Living in Little Italy & Chinatown
description: Close to arts and culture, restaurants and dining, and plenty of activities. Whether your visiting for a festival, explore our nation's capital, or for work, you’ll love your stay thanks to the prime location situated at the nexus of Little Italy and Chinatown, stylish furnishings, flood of natural light, comfy bed, high ceilings, and much more. This unit is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Feel like you're at your own "home away from home" in this private suite!
neighborhood_overview:
This amazing place is located just on the fringe of Little Italy and Chinatown, and is a short walk to mass transit (all major lines going East and West and 5 minute walk to O-Train)

Walk South on Preston and explore little shops and cafés or wonder to Dow's Lake and enjoy beautiful parks and Canada's Arboretum (Experimental Farms) - the perfect place for a picnic, sitting next to the famed Rideau Canal. On your trek South on Preston I recommend stopping in for a bite at Pubwells, pickup a picnic snack, or your deli and cheeses at Luciano's, a coffee or snack at Bridgehead Coffee, or brunch at any of Little Italy's restaurants. Go East on Somerset Street and explore Ottawa's Chinatown or head West and hip-it-up in the up and coming Hintonburg neighbourhood. You can also walk to the core of downtown or Parliament Hill in 20 minutes or take a 5 minute bus/taxi/uber ride.

Relax, play, enjoy and stay right in the heart of it all!
host_about: Naval Architect working in Ottawa Canada. I love to host guests in my AirBnB and I love to travel to other AirBnBs.

name: Spacious Fully Equipped Studio in Trendy Westboro
description: The studio has everything you'll need for a peaceful, comfortable, short or long term stay. In a separate building, it is private, beautifully decorated,  and super clean. There is great coffee, teas, homemade granola, reliable wifi, and internet TV as well as an outdoor space. The kitchenette is fully equipped. Centrally located, Westboro is full of fine restaurants, cafes, bakeries, and shops. We love hosting and we look forward to welcoming you to our home.
neighborhood_overview: A 10-minute walk from our place you will find dozens of wonderful restaurants, parks, cafes, consignment shops, coffee shops, gourmet food stores, supermarkets, pubs and boutiques. Five minutes away by car is the War Museum. Just 12 minutes away by car are the Parliament Buildings, downtown, the Market, the Art Gallery and the Rideau Centre. The airport is about 20 minutes away by car.
host_about: I am a recent PhD graduate. For my dissertation, I conducted research on the reintegration of formerly abducted young mothers in Northern Uganda. Five trips to Africa explains some of the art you will see. Malcolm is retired and makes guitars in his spare time. We really enjoy hosting and take pride in offering excellent customer service, and a clean, restful place for our guests.

name: Westboro BeachHouse, Netflix-Prime-Disney+
description: Unique & charming, this sun-drenched MCM home is exactly where you want to be. Comfy beds with pure cotton sheets welcome. Steps from the beach and in the heart of Westboro. A quick walk to restaurants and shops. It features a unique zen koi pond with private garden to relax and unwind, sunroom, marble & wood floors, stocked kitchen, fireplace, BBQ. neighborhood_overview: All the shops, restaurants and cafes of Westboro are a quick walk up the street.  Dominion station is a 2 minute walk to get you downtown on the transit way. Downtown is 5km away.
host_about: We're a small family from Canada's capital city.   We love the outdoors and appreciate good food.  We love a cozy comfortable atmosphere.  Evan is 16 years old now. host_about:
My Mom was the quintessential home maker and host. I learned hosting at her feet in Canada, in the Bahamas, and in Jamaica. I have been hosting friends and family from as far back as high school and college. Yes. Mine was the apartment where friends timed "just dropping in" knowing full well that food, a warm bed, or a respite was always there.

Along with my business degree and over 30 years runnung a Canada-wide financial services brokerage, I've found a perfect fit in accommodations both in Canada and in Jamaica.

Please join me in explOring my little slice of heaven. See you soon.
Cheers!

name: Elegant 1 Bedroom in Beechwood Village (Suite 2)
description: This location offers ground floor accommodation in a lovely and well-maintained home on quiet Vachon Avenue. Two blocks from Beechwood Village, you will be walking distance to an upscale and vibrant community. Lovingly renovated, this bright suite feels like an upscale condo, with modern furnishings and tons of function. A shared yard is available for barbecues or bicycle storage. Brushing the east side of Ottawa, this location puts you within 15 minutes of where you want to go around the city.
neighborhood_overview: Bordering New Edinburgh and Rockcliffe Park, Beechwood Village is a charming neighborhood with many national landmarks. From the grounds of the Governor General's residence at Rideau Hall, to beautiful Beechwood Cemetery there is a wide choice of places to visit on bike or on foot. The peaceful paths of the Ottawa river are nearby and the vibrant Byward Market is only a short ride over the St. Patrick Street bridge. Village Suites is walking distance to the shops of Beechwood Avenue where good coffee, fresh flowers, warm bread or a bus stop are at your fingertips.
host_about:
Hello. I am a real estate investor in Ottawa, which is a tremendous place to visit. I enjoy hosting through AirBNB and sharing the fun of being in the capital city. The reason Village Suites came to be was to provide people with the kind of accommodation that I would like to stay in; clean, stylish with a place for everything and everything in its place. Having traveled extensively through work and also with my family, I really appreciate having the "right" place to stay. Our locations are in safe, walkable neighborhoods with every convenience at your fingertips. This account was previously managed by my husband Dave, so you will see his name in a lot of the historical reviews. We didn't want to start a new account and lose all the good press!

Please send me a message if I can answer any questions for you while you are planning your stay in Ottawa. - Jane

We combined geometric shapes, luxury comfort and classic materials into this “small space” fit for a king….or queen. We hope you enjoy your stay with us at the Art House Airbnb.
neighborhood_overview:
Centretown, the beating heart of the city, exudes a dynamic urban energy in a compact package. This central neighborhood effortlessly merges historic charm with modern liveliness. A stroll along its tree-lined streets reveals a diverse architectural landscape, from historic homes to contemporary residences.

Culturally rich, Centretown hosts an array of galleries, theaters, and vibrant street art, celebrating local creativity. Culinary enthusiasts will delight in its diverse dining scene, offering everything from trendy bistros to international flavors. The neighborhood's green spaces provide a refreshing escape, balancing urban living with nature.

Centretown isn't just a residential haven; it's a thriving commercial hub with accessible amenities. The well-connected public transit ensures seamless connectivity, making it a convenient locale for work and leisure. In essence, Centretown encapsulates the essence of urban living, offering a lively, diverse, and conveni

name: Nicely appointed In-Law Suite with amenities.
description: The in law suite is located in the lower level of a large home in Orleans in the East end of Ottawa.The in-law suite has a bedroom (double bed) w/desk & television ; living room w/fireplace & a fold down sofa suitable for 1 person and a television. Guests can use the exercise room equipped w/treadmill, exercise bike, elliptical & weights, etc.
neighborhood_overview: Orleans is an East End area of Ottawa. By car in non rush hours it is a 10 minute drive to the Centretown The River bike paths are a couple of blocks away and a lovely beach on the Ottawa River located at Petrie's Island is 5 minutes away by car or 20 minutes by bicycle. Plenty of good  restaurants & shopping in the area.
host_about:
Born and raised in Ottawa and still living in Ottawa, I know the City quite well and can help guests with suggestions of sights and experiences in Ottawa. I am also a Realtor and have quite often assisted guests moving to the City find homes or condos to purchase.  
I have been sharing my home with hundreds of guests for over 5 years and enjoy meeting and chatting with guests from all over the world.  I do have a new addition to the household since lonely Pandemic days; Covi is an adorable male cat born in 2020. He is quite used to different guests moving in and out.
I do encourage you to read the generous reviews of past guests who mostly say its a quiet, clean and somewhat upsacle home without the pretence...i am also known to often make a welcome breakfast for guests when time permits.

name: ★Glebe suite on Monk Street with parking★
description:
Cozy, bright and quiet apartment in the Glebe next to Lansdowne Park and TD place with a private parking spot. Entire apartment is newly designed and furnished for AirBnB. AC and in-floor heating system.
Living area is upstairs and the bathroom and bedroom are downstairs – with a comfortable 6’ 6” ceiling (see pics). Laundry facilities in the unit. Due to city policy, we accept long-term (>29 days) bookings only. Contact for details.
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban suburb that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and the Ott
host_about: My wife and I have settled back in Canada after eight years of living overseas in India, Dubai and Hong Kong.  We loved our travels but also love Ottawa, our beautiful Canadian capital.  There is so much to do and see here and we live right in the heart of this amazing city!  We look forward to hosting you for your Ottawa visit.  Thankyou, Bart and Ariane

name: Bright heritage Westboro home for the plant lover!
description:
Charming home in Westboro Village; safe and thriving neighbourhood.
Bright light pours in every room, eclectic decor with an incredible plant collection - this house is buzzing with good energy.
Enjoy the walkability of Westboro while exploring the many coffee shops, restaurants & boutiques.
5 minute walk to Westboro Beach & transit way, 10 minute drive downtown.
Ideal for a professional on business or a couple visiting Ottawa.
You will feel right at home in this unique living space.
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro (often referred to as Westboro Village) is an area in the west end of Ottawa, Ontario. Located along the Ottawa River, Island Park Drive defines the Westboro's eastern border, while The Ottawa River defines its northern border.
Westboro Village is one of the most unique and diverse neighbourhoods in Ottawa. You’ll enjoy tree-lined streets, shop in one-of-a-kind boutiques and popular stores, spend time in welcoming outdoor spaces, dine at Ottawa’s trendiest spots and enjoy the natural beauty of Westboro Beach and the scenic views of Gatineau Hills - all within walking distance.
host_about: Living from the heART. Consciously curating a meaningful reality day by day where life is all the work and all the play. Smiling, connecting, and pondering; I dream more than I sleep. I love plants, making beautiful spaces and meandering while writing poetry in my head. Interested in all things creative. I've been teaching yoga and mindfulness for the last 8 years and it has brought me so much joy. Highly sensitive empath - it's my superpower!
