name: Room w/double in Byward homestay close to uOttawa
description:
Welcome to our heritage home located in Ottawa's Byward Market, walking distance to shops, museums, the Rideau Canal and the Parliament Buildings. We offer a homestay experience, ideal for students!

Private room with a double bed in a renovated heritage home in the ByWard Market area. Enjoy a homestay environment, well located to universities, attractions and services. Long term guests can enjoy 'meals included' -- perfect for students.

Walk to uOttawa, easy access to Carleton, UQO, UNAM.
host_about: Geoff and I have lived in our heritage home for 30 years.  Now with our children grown and gone we love to keep our extra rooms full with guests from all over the world.  We live right in the centre of the city but yet in a quiet residential area.  You can walk to all the major attractions in the city as well as uOttawa, many embassies and if you like nightlife, just blocks away.  We have a precocious little Welsh Terrier, Wally, who really runs our house!  If you are looking for a family home in the heart of things then we are the place for you.  Meals are included for our long term guests but can also be provided for an extra fee to short term guests.

name: Tranquil One Bedroom in Hintonburg
description: This tranquil one-bedroom apartment can accommodate one guest. It is perfect for travellers visiting Ottawa to explore Canada's capital or for travellers conducting a business or conference trip. The private setting and hip neighbourhood, in addition to the proximity and easy accessibility to the downtown core, the federal government campus Tunney's Pasture, and the Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus make this an ideal home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.
host_about:
I love to travel - to see new places, experience different cultures, eat local dishes, and meet people from all corners of the globe.

I am excited to welcome guests from all walks of life to Ottawa and aim to give them a warm, welcoming home during their stay.

description: Cute, Clean and Cozy two bedroom downtown Ottawa, minutes walk from the Canal, Elgin street, Museum of Nature, Parliament, Grocery stores, banks, pharmacy, liquor, beer store, shopping, bars, restaurants, bike paths and more! neighborhood_overview:
You are located seconds away from the canal where you can hop on a bike or walking path for a scenic route to Museums, Lansdowne, The Byward Market, The Glebe, Preston street, Tulip festival, Winterlude and much more.

Parliament Hill and the Byward Market is about a 25 minute walk/5 min drive or ten min bike ride away.

Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots.
Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you.

Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself laid out the street plan of the Market, designating George Street and York Street to be extra wide to accommodate the creation of a public market and gathering place.

name: 1 bedroom apartment
description: We live in a quite neighborhood just 4km to the city centre if you are looking for restaurants, museums and night life. On Sundays in the summer from 9:00am-1:00pm the city closes down our parkways for cars.  This allows cyclist, runners and rollerbladers to travel for miles without traffic. If you like hiking, the Gatineau hills are about 20kms.
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quite neighborhood close to the city. We love to go to Bobby's restaurant for breakfast.  Bacon, eggs, toast and coffee for $5.99
host_about:
My husband and I are both retired and love to be active.  We spend most of our time either doing yoga, biking, golfing and traveling.  We love to venture out in the our beautiful city of Ottawa. We love movies, live theatre and music, great food or simply relaxing and reading a book.
Our home is small bungalow with a finished basement that is fully contained.  There are a few low spots in the basement where the bulkhead is just under 6'. There is a separate entrance, private bath, your own laundry facilities, fully contained kitchen and living room.  We live about 4 km to the city centre. One bus ride will take you there. My sister used to live with us but has recently moved to Toronto.

name: Beautiful Clean Canadian Experience -Exec Rentals
description:
Beautiful space in Canada's Capital

Clean, conscious Canada themed private unit. Located on recreational pathways in West End you'll experience a modern, yet vintage Canadian decor dedicated to national art works and conservation. Long term executive bookings preferred.


Features include:
- Complimentary bicycles to experience vast pathways of Ottawa and Quebec
- Wifi
- Free Parking
- Beautiful gazebo
- Shopping, restaurants, IKEA, Algonquin College within walking distance
neighborhood_overview: Located in Ottawa's West's Whitehaven/ QTN - a quiet, safe, established neighborhood.  Located within walking distance of Algonquin College, major transit hub, some of the cities best restaurants, Pinecrest Creek, lush green spaces,  Britannia beach, IKEA and shopping. The residence is at the foot of the Sir John A MacDonald parkway that runs along the Ottawa River.... a scenic drive, or blissful bike ride to downtown and Quebec in minutes.
host_about:
It’s a Beautiful Day in my Neighborhood!  Glad you cruised by...

I live a life full of adventure, purpose, and laughs. 

I have enjoyed a diverse and eclectic career which has led me to where I am now...with the Ottawa Fire Department as my "day" job, CEO of a clean technology company as my passion job, and a stand up comic and Stadium MC/ Host for the Ottawa Redblacks CFL team as my part time jobs...and of course, being a Superhost to a unique AirBnB at my residence in Ottawa. 

While globetrotting over the past twenty years I discovered what works at an Airbnb and have curated my own space to be clean, comfortable, and convenient for my guests. My Airbnb meets the highest standards... my own. 

As a life long Ottawan I know the city like no one else. As a younger man I was the doorman at the Chateau Laurier (Ottawa's most iconic, historic hotel) where I learned the importance of guest service while attending to a VIP clientele of Canadian and international public figures. 

I am bilingual in French and English.

I have traveled the world performing stand up comedy.

I have worked with children affected by HIV.

I am, by virtue of cultural and familial upbringing, polite and considerate.

I am a huge proponent of the circular economy and offer a low-waste space at my BnB.

I am sure I will enjoy meeting you if you have read this far and are still reading.

- Geoffrey

name: TopView onto Ottawa River from Stylish Pad
description:
Watch beautiful sunsets over the Ottawa River from a spacious balcony, comfy living room, elevated dining room, open kitchen or cozy bedrooms of this 20th floor condo!

Enjoy walking, jogging or biking along the Ottawa River paths to Parliament, Byward Market, Museums or Health Canada in Tunney's Pasture.

This classy condo has a fine Gym, Squash Court, steamy Sauna, super Swimming Pool and so much more! However, the latter may NOT be available, as per COVID-19 Provincial Orders/Rules.
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood has a few fairly nearby grocery stores, namely a wonderful Farm Boy, and large Loblaws as well as a Metro. There are a few pizza parlours and a Thai take-out place nearby too. Across the Ottawa riverside Parkway is a very green path for walkers, joggers and cyclists, which passes through a marvelous wildlife conservation area. It’s along the Ottawa River, so very green, plenty of trees, geese, ducks and other birds. If you’re lucky you’ll see a beaver! A beautiful oasis of nature, just a few minutes away from this beautiful 20th-floor home!

There are also plenty of indoor and outdoor tennis courts, nearby. Britannia Beach, where there is friendly volleyball and public swimming, is about a 20-minute walk away.

There should be an LRT by 2024!
host_about:
Hi there socially-astute traveller!

As a traveller, I have enjoyed AirBnBs in Paris, NYC and Istanbul to name a few, over the past years.  Curious about other cultures and places, I am a University Communications Professor and promote Education Internationally via my work at Canada's Foreign/Global Affairs Department.

As a host, I look forward to making your short (or perhaps longer) stay in Ottawa a most delicious, amazing and memorable one!

May your travels see you discover plenty!

Welcome to 277 a few blocks to the Byward Market heart of Ottawa!

Alex

host_about:
My Mom was the quintessential home maker and host. I learned hosting at her feet in Canada, in the Bahamas, and in Jamaica. I have been hosting friends and family from as far back as high school and college. Yes. Mine was the apartment where friends timed "just dropping in" knowing full well that food, a warm bed, or a respite was always there.  
I'm also a connector/networker and a go-to person who loves people,  travelling, cooking, gardening, interior decorating as well as domestic science. Along with my business degree and over 30 years runnung a Canada-wide financial services brokerage, I've found a perfect fit in accommodations both in Canada and in Jamaica.
I'm also a mom and step-mom of a total of  of 5 Gen-X & Gen-Y, and a grandmother of 6, Daniel's wife, a former financial advisor and financial columnist, a gardening blogger, a socialite, a fashion stylist, a Mistress of Ceremony and a writer. I can manage in French and can count in Spanish...high school Spanish.
Please join me in explOring my little slice of heaven. See you soon.
Cheers!

description:
Welcome to The CasaGrotto, your private resort-style bungalow, designed for ultimate relaxation and indulgence. Dive into the luxurious 40' x 20' pool, unwind in the 8-person hot tub, or rejuvenate in the spacious 8-person wet/dry sauna.

neighborhood_overview:
Beaverbrook is bounded by March Road to the north and east, Campeau Drive to the south, and just to the west of Carr, Pentland, Tiffany and Reaney Crescents. Beaverbrook is one of the original neighbourhoods of the former city of Kanata.

The area remained mainly agricultural until the 1960s, when it was developed from rural land that was acquired by Bill Teron. The neighbourhood was built using a model community approach, which made Beaverbrook into an independent neighbourhood that has its own unique character and commercial services.
host_about: I am a e-commerce entrepreneur who enjoys travelling and meeting new people.  I enjoy hosting people from around the world and am more than happy to share my home with you and like minded travelers.

name: Charming Home in Trendy Westboro /10min DT
description: Stay away from the hustle and bustle.  Stay in Westboro!, Ottawa's most luxurious neighbourhood.  This charming and tranquil home situated on a beautiful street is steps from Richmond St., Ottawa’s trendiest spot for shopping and dinning.  It is conveniently located close to highway 417 East&West exits, grocery stores, liquor store, pharmacy.  Enjoy many beautiful bike paths, Westboro beach.  10 mins drive from downtown and 15 minutes to Gatineau Park. Stay with us and you won't be disappointed!
neighborhood_overview: We are situated in a family friendly neighbourhood. Westboro is one of the most unique and diverse neighbourhoods in Ottawa. You’ll enjoy tree-lined streets, shop in one-of-a-kind boutiques and popular stores, spend time in welcoming outdoor spaces, dine at Ottawa’s trendiest spots and enjoy the natural beauty of Westboro Beach and the scenic views of Gatineau Hills.
host_about: I am an accountant.  However, I am passionate about interior design and architect.  I also love the outdoor, walking and hiking.  It's been a pleasure being an airbnb host.  I got a chance to meet some wonderful people from all over the world.  You can be assured you'll be well taken care of staying with me.

name: West end Ottawa, quiet neighborhood, nice locale
description:
This location is in the Bay neighborhood in Ottawa. Nearby parks include Maki Park, Lake view Park and Dick Bell Park. Our home is on a quiet street in a safe and quiet neighborhood.

Complete access to all house amenities, including kitchen, washer and dryer, and common living room. We do not book out multiple rooms, so you will be the only guest sharing the common living areas.
neighborhood_overview: Crystal beach neighborhood is very quiet, safe, and tranquil.  Just a 7 minute walk to Andrew Haydon park, a big beautiful park on the Ottawa River.
host_about:
Welcome to our charming and modest home! 
We are just 20 mins drive to downtown.
just 2 minutes walk to OCtranspo bus # 152.
It is 5 minutes drive to Bayshore Shopping mall, and 10 minutes walk to Nepean Sailing Club (Dick Bell Park).It is 3 - 5 minutes drive to Wesley Clover Parks. 30 minutes walking to DnD Carling.

Hardwood floors,  plenty of natural light. You will find a big closet, desk & reading lamps in your room along with a super comfy bed, and we have great parking place for you.

We welcome you to our home with open arms, and can't wait to share our vast knowledge and experiences of the city and places that we visited.  We like to share out local knowledge about activities around Ottawa

Countries we’ve Visited

Australia, Colombia, Cuba, El Salvador, Guatemala, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Myanmar, Nicaragua, Panama, Papua New Guinea, Viet Nam, Singapore, Japan, Thailand, France, Italy, Morroco, Portugal

name: Cozy Art Deco bedroom in a country setting
description: I am offering accommodation in an executive-style home with a large bedroom, private bathroom, large chef's kitchen with granite counte r tops, laundry, hardwood floor and parking. The home is set in a peaceful country-style living, beautiful garden, and a completely private setting.
neighborhood_overview: The home is located on a 2-acre lot with a large spectacular garden and distant neighbours. This is rural living in designated greenspace but with quick access to Ottawa. The location is perfect if you're en route from Ottawa to Montreal or vice versa.
host_about:
I am a retired public servant living in a country-setting in a community in the green belt of  Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. I enjoy greenspace, the arts and culture, people that are different, eclectic and interesting. And I'm an avid gardener and love jazz. I love travelling, especially to the Caribbean...definitely not at a resort. I need to live like real people, in real cities/villages/communities. If I was born in the '60s I would have been a hippie. 

I would not be able to live without at least six months of heat (25 deg or warmer), sand between my toes, and a view of the sea. 

I live my life by being who I am, and I expect those around me to be who they are...let's keep it real.

name: Explore the hidden treasures of Ottawa!
description: This is a great little suite suitable for one person. I live in a quiet well treed suburb. The decor is rustic. You will normally have  a private bathroom, living room, kitchenette,. This is a ideal space for longer stays. The bedroom is always private.
neighborhood_overview: I am within an easy walk to two hospitals, a shopping center and bus routes. It is a very quiet neighbourhood
host_about:
I am a psychotherapist and an avid cyclist. I have created numerous charity events and am passionate about community, people and life. I love learning from other people and opening my home seems like a natural fit for me.

I have two pets, both of whom are rescue. Luna the dog is a puppy mill survivor and Quincy the cat was abandoned after his owner died. Please let me know if you wish your stay to be with or without Quincy! If it is without Quincy, I will make sure he stays in the upper part of my home.

I am a wonderful cook and if you wish can provide breakfast. Your area has a private livingroom, private bathroom, private kitchenette and a shared fridge.

Ottawa is a fabulous place to visit. There is so much to see and to do. I can advise you as to little known locations off the beaten track to make your stay even more enjoyable.

While staying with me, you have parking and unlimited WIFII. In addition I have a lovely patio that you can use. 

I look forward to meeting and sharing experiences with you.

I am fluently bilingual in French and English and can manage in Spanish.

Cheers

Karine

name: ★ Beautiful, modern, Glebe Loft with free parking★
description: This gorgeous modern fully renovated (for AirBnB) one-bedroom suite has its own separate entrance, bathroom, open concept living room, bedroom and kitchen, and is within a 2 minute walk to the Rideau Canal, Lansdowne Park which offers great restaurants & bars, shopping, and sporting events. The canal is one block away - great for walking, running and biking. Due to city policy, we accept long-term (>29 days) bookings only. Contact for details.
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban neighborhood that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and t
host_about: My wife and I have settled back in Canada after eight years of living overseas in India, Dubai and Hong Kong.  We loved our travels but also love Ottawa, our beautiful Canadian capital.  There is so much to do and see here and we live right in the heart of this amazing city!  We look forward to hosting you for your Ottawa visit.  Thankyou, Bart and Ariane

Loblaws plaza across the street has more groceries which sells VQA wines, Starbucks, Booster Juice, RBC, gym, fuel station and more. Down the street, Barley Mow's has great food, a wide array of beverages and many screens to watch the game. If you happen to indulge in a few too many cocktails, it's only a 5 minute walk up the street to your abode for the evening, no need for Uber:) This is a Safe and quiet place so close to t

host_about:
I am Kash from CasaHill

I manage a full services vacation rental and a tour/experiences company CasaHill with just one goal. That goal is to provide you simply the best and highly positive experiences on your vacation. I have a dedicated, trusted team of Managers who share similar values and will also go above and beyond to ensure that you have a great time on your vacation. We are highly focused on providing unique personalized experiences and building a personal and a close connection to all the homes, owners and all our guests. I am a firm believer in the power of technology to greatly improve communication, connections, comfort and reach. I have over 20 years background in Information Technology consulting work, managing large scale Digital Transformation projects, Customer Relationship Management, Digital Marketing and Social Media. We also strongly believe in the new sharing economy as well as Airbnb's philosophy of inclusion, belonging and providing great experiences to all our guests by sharing beautiful homes in great destinations. Come, stay with us and experience the difference. 

My personal hobbies include learning Latin dancing such as Salsa, Bachata as well as focusing on physical, mental and spiritual fitness. I have lived and worked in various places in India, US (San Francisco, NYC), France (Paris) and Canada (Ottawa, Toronto, Winnipeg and Regina). In addition to travelling extensively within entire Canada, USA, Mexico, Europe, and India, I have also travelled to South America, Thailand, Laos, Egypt, Ukraine, Turkey and Morocco and looking for the next travel adventure.

name: Home Sweet One Bedroom in Hintonburg
description: This one-bedroom apartment can accommodate up to two guests. It is perfect for travelers visiting Ottawa to explore Canada's capital or for travelers conducting a business or conference trip. The private setting and hip neighbourhood, in addition to the proximity and easy accessibility to the downtown core, the federal government campus Tunney's Pasture, and the Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus make this an ideal home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.
host_about:
I love to travel - to see new places, experience different cultures, eat local dishes, and meet people from all corners of the globe.

I am excited to welcome guests from all walks of life to Ottawa and aim to give them a warm, welcoming home during their stay.

host_about:
I'm an Ottawa architect with one foot in the city and the other in the forest.  I prefer anything outdoors and get out as often as I can.  I'm dedicated to my work/clients and promote balance and sustainability through good design and smart technologies.  As a family, we spend our time balancing regular evening sporting runs for the kids with weekend hiking/skiing/mountain biking/camping trips in our VW van.  

Over the years, we have had the privilege of being a guest throughout Canada, the US and Europe.  Now I am proud to be a host and I look forward to giving guests the opportunity to relax, kick back and enjoy Canada's capital city!

name: Bright 1 bedroom on the park, close to everything
description:
Newly built, bright and contemporary 1 bedroom apartment. This well equipped space has everything you need for a comfortable stay in Ottawa.

Our house is located in Old Ottawa South, between the Rideau River and the Rideau Canal, two blocks from trendy bank street and a quick bike ride or bus to downtown.

Walk out your private entrance directly into the 10 acre gem of Windsor park. Enjoy a game of tennis or basketball, a dip in the wading pool or an evening paddle on the Rideau in our canoe.
neighborhood_overview: Old Ottawa South, situated between the Rideau River to the south and the Rideau Canal to the north, is one of Ottawa's most vibrant communities. We're a 5 minute walk to Bank Street which has coffee shops, restaurants, shopping and an independent movie theatre. Within a ten minute walk is Lansdowne Park which offers tons of trendy restaurants, a Whole Foods, Cineplex Odeon, TD Place stadium for concerts and sporting events, and more.

I love seeing new places, meeting new people and having good conversation.

name: Cozy and Bright in Crystal Beach - West Ottawa
description: Hi, welcome to our home in the west end of Ottawa close to Kanata. We are a short walk to the river and close to Dick Bell park and the Nepean Sailing Club , Andrew Hayden Park, Department of National Defense Carling campus and Shirleys Bay, Wesley Clover Parks  and about 8 minutes from the Queensway Carleton Hospital. A short drive to Bayshore Mall and Brittania Beach. Easy access to Carling Ave and the Queensway and Ottawa cycling paths and bus routes.
neighborhood_overview:
Crystal Beach is located in the west end of Ottawa next to the National Capital Commission Green Belt and close to the Ottawa River. It is a well established residential community comprised of mostly bungalow and split level homes built in the 1960's.
Local shopping, groceries, pharamcies and restaurants are a few minutes away in Bells Corners to the south and a variety of small stores, restaurants and cafes, Cineplex Cinemas and Bayshore Shopping Centre to the East. A little further to the west is the 19th Tee driving range and mini putt and some local produce stands.
host_about: My wife Margot and I are mostly retired and live in the west Ottawa community of Crystal Beach close to our daughter and son in law and our grandchildren. We also host an AirBnB studio unit in our home.

name: ★ Beautiful, modern, Glebe Home with Garage★
description:
One of the very few century homes to undergo a complete renovation. There is 2800 sq ft of living area and an attached garage. Guests will find a well stocked kitchen and ample space for relaxing and entertaining. We have removed our personal possessions to allow guests to enjoy the space as their own.

Sep 23 review..”Wow… just … wow…. Your house is spectacular…. Every time I turn a corner I’m shocked…. It’s even more beautiful than the pictures”
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban suburb that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and the Ott
host_about: My wife and I have settled back in Canada after eight years of living overseas in India, Dubai and Hong Kong.  We loved our travels but also love Ottawa, our beautiful Canadian capital.  There is so much to do and see here and we live right in the heart of this amazing city!  We look forward to hosting you for your Ottawa visit.  Thankyou, Bart and Ariane

neighborhood_overview:
Alta Vista is a highly residential neighbourhood with a strong community, several schools, churches, and community centres. It also has a vast amount of greenspace and parks, much of which is part of the Alta Vista Transportation Corridor Environment.

The OC Transpo Transitway also runs through Alta Vista, with two stations in the neighbourhood itself (Pleasant Park and Riverside) as well as two just outside (Billings Bridge and Smyth), serving as a vital transit link to the rest of the city.

The General Campus of the Ottawa Hospital, and The Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario are located just on the north side of Smyth Road, in Riverview, while the Riverside Campus of the Ottawa Hospital is located at Smyth and Riverside Drive. There are two shopping malls in and around Alta Vista: the Billings Bridge Plaza Shopping Centre at Bank Street and Riverside and the Elmvale Shopping Centre at St. Laurent and Smyth.
host_about:
Hello!
My name is Charles. My lovely wife's name is Darlene. We live in Ottawa, Canada. We are both young professionals (Chartered Accountant  and Physician). We would love to host you in our private, pleasant and beautiful studio. 
Cheers!

name: One Bedroom Oasis in Hintonburg
description: This newly renovated, cozy, one-bedroom apartment in a 100 year old house can accommodate up to two guests. The unique house, hip neighbourhood, and proximity to the downtown core, the federal government campus Tunney's Pasture, and the Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus make this a perfect home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.
host_about:
I love to travel - to see new places, experience different cultures, eat local dishes, and meet people from all corners of the globe.

I am excited to welcome guests from all walks of life to Ottawa and aim to give them a warm, welcoming home during their stay.

Babbos Italian Cuisine - Award winning italian fine dining

The Vault Bistro - Manotick's newest bsitro

La Piazza - Local hotspot, good food, entertainment, well-reviewed..

The community boat launch is across the water from this home's dock, and can handle most large boats.

name: Peloton House Garden Suite
description: Peloton House is a stunning apartment on the ground floor of a lovingly renovated historic 1867 build. Located in the central, old-world Heritage Conservation District of New Edinburgh; a stone's throw from rivers, parks, the Governor General's residence, the Byward market and the National Gallery.  A high-end apartment that combines the freshness of modern design with period details and original artwork from throughout North America.
neighborhood_overview: New Edinburgh is one of Ottawa's loveliest neighbourhoods.  We are a stone's throw from the Governor General's residence and are a 20 minute walk to the Byward market, as well as a number of shops, restaurants and neighbourhood pubs.  We are also right next a lovely large riverside park to stroll through and many skating and cycling paths. We offer excellent access to Gatineau Park.
host_about: Loves winter and loves Mexico.  A first generation Canadian with two Mexican rescue dogs and one Mexican spouse for a family that is 75% Mexican.  I am a slow traveler who loves to putter around in one place for a long time to get a sense of the place.  As a property owner, I have an eye for detail and place service above all else.  As a human being, I value compassion and community.

name: Elegant Chic GLEBE home steps to Canal & TD Place
description:
Choose a coffee table book and spend an evening by a living room fireplace. Prepare for bed in a marble-lined bathroom with vintage-chic fixtures and get cozy in a fluffy robe. In the morning discover a gourmet kitchen and a back deck for fresh air.

This FAB sparkling-clean gem is at the Fifth Avenue entrance to Ottawa's world famous Canal. We work hard to make your vacation or work stay a 5 STAR experience and ALL of our guests have agreed that this home delivers!

Please read the reviews. They are outstanding.

My Airbnb is close to EVERYTHING in Ottawa's best neighbourhood, the Glebe. Walk to TDPlace (3min), the Lansdowne stadium, Carleton University, restaurants, theatres, shopping and Bank Street. Just a hop along the Canal to Parliament, downtown, the Byward market, CHEO and Ottawa U.

Cozy and homey. Warm and welcoming. Fun and functional.

* Brand new Beauty Rest 2,000 coil King bed
* Brand new Kingsdown Queen bed
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the heart of the Glebe near TD Lansdowne and close to theaters, restaurants, shopping and parks. Walk to Carleton University, U of O and take a short transit ride to Parliament Hill. The Rideau Canal is out the front door.
host_about:
I love creating beautiful homes and cozy spaces.  Décor should be functional but have an air of fun and whimsy. 

My Ottawa home is perfect for the road weary traveller or the overnight executive!  There is no better location for skating on the world famous Rideau Canal. 

My home is well situated for the adventure crowd or the home body wanting to bring family and friends together around the fire — or the dining table. 

I love my home and I know others love it too!  Please read my reviews. Guests rave about the location, the cleanliness, the amazing host (that’s me!), and the comfort and quality of the beds and furnishings. 

When not prepping for guests, I love traveling, playing tennis, meeting new people and hanging with my pup Bella. 

I look forward to your stay. 

Bienvenue, Donna Wishart

description:
Discover this bright, modern semi-detached home on Ottawa’s Embassy Row. Located across from Strathcona Park along the Ottawa River, it offers abundant natural light and access to picturesque nature trails for walking/biking. Sandy hill is situated within walking distance of the ByWard Market, so shares many services and shops of the market, including grocery stores and the transitway. Located close to downtown, Sandy Hill has excellent public transportation, a large shopping complex, and many schools to serve its families. Sandy Hill is bounded by Rideau-Besserer-Daly Avenue on the north, both Highway 417 and Nicholas Street to the south, the Rideau River to the east, and the Rideau Canal to the west. This neighbourhood includes the community of Strathcona Heights and the University of Ottawa.
As a residential community, Sandy Hill dates back to the 1870s and was the wealthiest and most prestigious neighbourhood in the Ottawa area up until the early 20th century. Some of the neighbourhood’s notable locations include Laurier House, the residence of Prime Ministers Sir Wilfred Laurier and William Lyon Mackenzie-King, and the house of WWI ace Billy Bishop, which was later inhabited by another Prime Mini
host_about: I am a creative soul that loves to travel and explore the world.  Born in England but along my travels made Canada my home and native land.  My life’s motto is to be present and live in the moment.  As an artist, I love to create and discover new things and as your host, I have tried to create a modern, minimalist, boutique hotel style experience for you.  I welcome you to my home and I hope you enjoy it as much as I have.

host_about:
Urban Nest - Perfect Stays

Stay in the heart of Montreal's  trendiest neighbourhoods.

name: Governor's Gate
description:
Bright, modern two-bedroom loft. King, Double and sofa bed. Vaulted ceilings. Separate entrance.
Quiet residential street in the heritage neighbourhood of New Edinburgh. Walk to embassies, Global Affairs Canada, restaurants, shops, and parks. Steps to Governor General's official residence. Blocks from the Prime Minister's residence. Short ride to Byward Market, National Gallery, National Arts Centre, downtown - or a pleasant walk along Sussex Drive.
neighborhood_overview: After years of living in different areas of Ottawa, we have fond memories of New Edinburgh.  Our children attended a nearby school and spent innumerable hours after-school at the local ballet academy.  We divided our time between the beautiful running paths alongside the river and the welcoming local pubs.  Our favourite local bakery, The Scone Witch, began in the corner of a nearby house, which now houses the Union Street Kitchen and Yoga Studio.  Although work has taken us away, we maintain our home for our own return visits and we are very happy to make it available to visitors, because we want to share the feeling of living in a warm, familiar setting that we are certain others will appreciate.
host_about:
Professional working couple with four teenage daughters.
Best family vacations have been those that were three weeks or longer.
Last minute planners.  Favourite travel destinations include Paris, Tuscan countryside, cities in Europe and beaches in France, Greece, North Carolina, Cuba and Florida. 
Life motto:  "Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might..." Eccl. 9:10

description:
Nestled in the heart of Old Ottawa South, this sun drenched apartment is an ideal short term rental for art lovers, culture seekers, diplomats, and professionals seeking a thoughtfully curated, professionally designed home.

Steps away from the Rideau Canal (a Unesco World Heritage Site), and surrounded by hip coffee shops and tasty restaurants, you couldn't be more centrally located.
neighborhood_overview: Ottawa may be known for Prime Minister Trudeau and the longest skating rink in the world (both are walking distance from my apartment!), but really what makes me love this city are the crystal blue skies, the best vegetarian food in the world (you MUST visit the Green Door Restaurant, 15 minute walk), and the exquisite Experimental Farm (a short drive or 40 minute walk from my home). The city is super clean, and my area in particular is bustling with the perfect mix of historic residential homes, sweet cafes, and great walking paths.
host_about: I'm a therapist from Ottawa, Canada. I split my time between my hometown and NYC, where my two adult daughters live. I love traveling, and am excited to use AirBnb to do more of it!

- Close to Kanata North Technology Park (high tech district)

- Walking distance to Legget drive

- Walking distance to Ciena, NOKIA, Ericson, Cisco, Blackberry, Saba Software and other hi-tech companies

- Walking distance to OC Transpo - Innovation Park & Ride (busses)

- Close to Canadian Tire Centre (Ottawa Senators), Arenas (Sensplex, KRN), Diefenbunker museum, parks

- Close to Shirley's Bay / Connaught Cadet Training Centre

- Close to DND (Department of National Defence), Carling Campus

- 13 minutes driving to Wesley Clover Parks

- Close to The Marshes Golf Club

- 30 minutes driving to Mount Pakenham ski hill

- Close to all amenities, Kanata Centrum Shopping Center & Signature Center, Walmart, AMC/Empire Theatres, Tanger outlets mall, Loblaws, restaurants

- Walking distance to City of Ottawa Richcraft Recre

name: Poole Creek Paradise
description: This beautiful bungalow has hardwood floors throughout and a bright open concept living, dining and kitchen area. The house backs onto Poole Creek and has access to the Trans Canada Trails – ideal for biking and walking. A large patio with BBQ area allows for relaxation outside. Two rooms have very comfortable  beds, bookcases, a large closet, a desk, and dressers. Two sparkling clean private bathrooms are all yours. A pullout couch in the family room is available for two extra guests.
neighborhood_overview: All the shopping you would need and a wide variety of restaurants are within walking distance. The Tanger Mall, Kanata Centrum, Gym, Landmark Movie Theatre and Canadian Tire Centre are in close proximity. The walking trails are beautiful!
host_about: I'm a retired French, English and Music teacher who loves to travel across Europe, Canada, USA and Mexico.  If you stay over on a Tuesday, you may be able to join my "Guitar Groovers" in singing and/or playing a guitar! I would love to share stories from the book I've written ("Perseverance Pranks & Pride - Tales of the One-Room Schoolhouse"), and listen to your stories too. I also love to act, write and direct plays.

name: Private Room in a Friendly Family Home
description: Discounted for longer stays. Suitable for a young/mature professional or student who is clean, tidy, quiet, responsible, independent, and friendly. This room includes all utilities and good WIFI. Private parking and free street parking, laundry: washer, kitchen, dining/living room, a large private backyard with a patio. The home has a friendly family environment in a very safe and secure neighborhood with and conveniently located to shopping, public transit, parks, and highway access.
neighborhood_overview: Convenient to public transit and parks. Shopping and restaurants nearby. Free parking on location.
host_about: Janice is a semi retired arts and culture educator and Garry has a background in Emergency Management and Municipal Government. The historic Gothic stone church is a family homestead that has been lovingly restored over many years. They enjoy travelling with their children around the world and showing them as much about the world as possible, connecting them to its people, nature, architecture, culture, food and art.  They believe each day holds adventures and lessons. They appreciate and value sharing their home, their knowledge and their time to help enrich the lives of those they meet. They love the outdoors, sports, music, films, and cooking together.  They are experienced hosts and have a long history with acting as host family to those new to the country and to their community. They enjoy promoting local culture, businesses, the arts and sharing tips about their Town with others so they can feel like a 'Local'.  Sharing brings people around the world closer and they appreciate the friendships they make from their travels as well as from those they've had the privilege of hosting.

name: Traveller's Nest - Your Cozy Home in Ottawa
description: Situated in a quiet yet centrally located street, this newly renovated 2-bedroom suite is just steps from the canal, restaurants, cafés, bus/metro, and all the attractions that Canada's capital city has to offer. Park your car in our private driveway and cycle or walk (or skate in winter!) along bucolic riverside paths into the heart of the city. In summer, enjoy your morning organic coffee listening to the birds on the backyard terrace. In winter, cozy up in front of your own gas fireplace.
neighborhood_overview:
Want to enjoy a great coffee, eat in one of the best vegetarian restaurants in Ottawa, or hit a farmer's market on a Saturday morning? No problem - they are all just a 5 minute walk away.

Walk just a few hundred metres south on Main Street to Sula Wok for delicious Asian street food or Vespa Wine Bar for delicious wines and Italian fare. The Green Door restaurant, an Ottawa icon, is just a few steps further for a delicious vegetarian meal. On Saturdays from 9 am-3 pm in summer there is also a farmer's market in the parking lot next to the restaurant. We can also recommend a number of great, reasonably priced Vietnamese restaurants just a little further afield (25-30 min walk).

Other cafes and restaurants, a large grocery store (Loblaw's), and a liquor store are just a 5-10 min walk away. Right around the corner is NU, a local no-waste grocery store. There is also a great Korean grocery (Seoul Mart) right behind Loblaw's if you love Asian food like us!
host_about: We are a well-travelled family of four who have settled back in Ottawa after living and working in Vietnam and the UAE for many years. After staying in dozens of amazing Airbnb's on our travels, we now look forward to hosting guests from around the world in the beautiful capital of Canada. We love any activity in the outdoors, cooking delicious food (especially Vietnamese!), and enjoying stimulating conversation with a glass of good wine, a cup of organic coffee, or a mug of hot herbal tea in hand.  Let's have one together!

name: The Craftsman’s Home
description: I am a custom home builder and I designed and built this home. The home was inspired by travels to NYC and Vienna. It's best described as a typical New York walk-up with a separated secondary dwelling below. The space being offered is the large principal residence. The lower unit is owner occupied but has separate and private entrances and outdoor spaces. It features many hand made elements and high quality finishes.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the Civic Hospital area and directly in front of the expanse of the historic experimental farm, you’ll wake to bright beautiful sunrises through the large living room window and enjoy the western sun on the rooftop deck or in the kitchen through the wall to wall patio door. The farm is a great location to walk or ride bikes and serves as the most beautiful scenic route to downtown as you pass along Dow’s lake and the Rideau canal.

This is an ideal location since it allows one to have excellent access to Centretown just 7 minutes away but also allows you to enjoy other arguably better parts of the city which reflect more on its character and offerings.

Hintonburg is a hip little neighbourhood with great social spots and is located just minutes away. East of Hintonburg is Little Italy and China town. 5 minutes west of the home is Westboro. These neighbourhoods have excellent restaurants, cafes and bars.
The home also has great access to the Glebe
host_about:
Custom home builder/designer.

Enjoys the outdoors, keeping active, culture, travel, architecture and design.

I'm lucky enough to have travelled a fair bit and when I do I generally prefer a cultured experience with locals than from a hotel. 

As an Airbnb host, I enjoy sharing the best of my town with guests from all over. Having experienced some great hosts myself from around the world, I have a good number of best practices to draw from and will be certain to extend them to each of my guests.

name: Up to Here - Where great vacays begin
description: Featuring a recently renovated, fully furnished private basement apartment with a small patio area, french dbl door entry. Each bedroom has a private locked door access. Minutes by car to groceries, 3 arenas, restaurants, gas station, shopping, a beach & marina on Ottawa River at Petrie Island. Easy walking distance to bus transit & priority bus route at the door. La Cite Collegiale trades training & Cdn Hockey Academy nearby. Students/athletes & family special rate. DM for details.
neighborhood_overview: One of Orleans best features is the lovely natural habitat and gorgeous beach at Petrie Island. The Island hosts a variety of events over the year such as Canada Day festivities and Carivibe. Spend the day swimming, hiking, exploring the beach or stop at the marina for a snack or a boat rental. http://www.oziles.com/rentals.html There are farmer's markets, festivals, great bakeries, eateries, local brewing companies, bike paths, and entertainment. Set in a semi-rural residential area its a five minute drive to the country or hop on the ferry for a visit to Quebec.
host_about:
My favourite way to travel is by staying at B&Bs and exploring the local area for farmer's markets, artisans, and meeting local people whether its a casual conversation at a local mom & pop diner or business. I never order food without checking with the locals for their faves and I rarely eat at chain food restaurants when there's a better local option. I would rather meet local people and get a sense of their community. I love to cook and with three kids & a husband to feed that's a good combination because boy, can they eat! Best vacations are family vacations. My teenagers still love to travel with us. I guess that says something about our travel adventures, and its a good thing! :) When we travel we make stops to see local curiosities and historic landmarks, often unplanned, screeching halt roadside and we pile out to check out a interesting relic or historic plaque/scene. I tidy a hotel room before I leave as if I was heading out of my own home and I tip the hotel staff. We love the theatre, live musical performances, animated kids movies, good local food and finding humour even in the worst of situations.
I love to meet new people and get to know them when I'm hosting, and I also respect their privacy or preference to be alone. I'm attentive to the guest's needs and like to accommodate as much as possible the guest's special requests.
My motto is do it now because someday I'll be sleeping the sleep of forever and I don't want to miss anything while I'm still here!

name: Emerald Meadows (Kanata South) Executive Townhouse
description: Bright, comfortable and clean - this 2 bedroom townhouse is conveniently located in Kanata (south). Free parking - driveway fits two cars plus a single garage. Self check-in! Family friendly neighbourhood. Children's playground just around the corner with public tennis courts. *Close to HWY 416*  Endless shopping plaza's/ box stores/ groceries/ cinema/ restaurants / trails / gym's / 9km drive to Canadian Tire Centre/ 12 km to north Kanata (tech companies) / 25km to downtown Ottawa.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, family friendly, meadow with walking paths nearby. Close to grocery stores, dollar store, Walmart, LCBO for alcohol. Close to Highway 416.
host_about:
Thanks for stopping by my profile. I have stayed at many Airbnb's across the globe.  I have always appreciated cleanliness above all and also little things like waking up after a travel day and seeing there is coffee for the coffee maker.  Not having to run outside - just makes the morning! I look forward to providing the most pleasant and painless Airbnb experience for you. 

 I like to balance life's craziness with fitness and nature - I love finding a new trail to walk my dogs and certainly enjoy a glass of wine or two  ;)  I pride myself on being courteous, clean & organized -  so when traveling I take care of your home as I would my own.  

Any questions, please feel free to ask! 

Cheers, Kelly :)

name: Renovated 2 Bdrm with Parking minutes to Downtown
description: Beautiful newly renovated two bedroom with parking on a quiet residential street. Perfect for families and business travellers. Your get away in Canada's capital. A bright and spacious 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom second floor apartment in a safe neighbourhood. 8 minute drive to downtown which is buzzing with farmers markets to Canadian made cheese, maple syrups and beaver tails. Walking distance to grocery stores, restaurants, pubs and much more.
neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.
host_about:
I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I have been an Airbnb host now for over 9 years. I love interacting with my guests and ensuring they're happy in their space. 

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.

New one bedroom apartment in quiet mature residential neighbourhood.
EV Level - 2 Charger, Free for all guests. 20 minute walk to General and CHEO hospitals. Safe and friendly neighbourhood, with lots of trees.
Walking distance to grocery store, swimming, skating and library. Great location for single professional, medical student or medical resident. Close access to downtown for meetings.
neighborhood_overview: We are at the western edge of Elmvale acres in Ottawa's east end. There are bike lanes to take you down town to parliament, the Rideau canal and the Byward Market along Smyth-Main street and over the new Flora, Pretoria or Corktown footbridges. The trees, quiet walking and friendly disposition of the neighbourhood make it a wonderful place to live and visit. Several parks are a short walk away including; Lynda Lane, Playfair, Grasshopper Hill, Weston and Canterbury park. Several outdoor skating rinks at these parks in winter are great fun especially the outdoor covered Jim Tubman rink at Canterbury. Check the city listings for all these proximal recreational facilities.  See City of Ottawa Canterbury Recreation complex info on the web for details such as swim times, public skating, community activities etc.
host_about: Geoscientist, loves outdoors, biking, aquariums and trains. Father of teenage son Noel and husband to Nancy.

I like to skate in the winter or use one of the trails to bike along the water in the summer. If you are looking to visit Canada's capital city, our Airbnb accommodations offer affordable pricing and easy access to a variety of activities. 

I love to travel and enjoy the experience that Airbnbs offer. I strive to provide the high-quality experience that I have come to expect from Airbnb. 

If you want to visit, don't hesitate to reach out! I would love to chat about how we can make my space work best for your needs.

name: Corporate-Stays -1B-Gorgeous Loft
description: Welcome to The Met! Enjoy the convenience of city life with our centrally located 1-bedroom unit, just a short walk from Parliament Hill, dining, and shopping. host_about:
Corporate Stays is the world's premier global network of executive corporate hospitality and serviced residences. 
Our mission is to provide overnight accommodations for business travelers in luxury, furnished apartments and serviced homes worldwide. 
Our standards demand that we select properties meeting our executive standards. 
As a global company, we combine our expertise with the local knowledge of our concierge staff who can assist you with any questions during your stay. Our committed team ensures that your stay is enjoyable, memorable, and stress-free from the time you book to the moment you check out. 
One of the most important goals is guest satisfaction. From booking to checkout, a team of dedicated concierges is present to insure your stay is enjoyable and up to standards.

name: Co-habit w/young professionals Ottawa ED2
description: Nicely furnished, comfortable and updated 1800 sq ft house that accommodates 4 young professionals.  This house is located in a safe, residential neighbourhood in the Central/West part of Ottawa close to transit. Parking is available. Laundry is onsite.
neighborhood_overview: This is a safe, secure and mature neighbourhood with excellent transit options and walking access - 12 - 20 minutes - to food stores, banks, pharmacies, clothing, restaurants. Public transit is good and reliable from this address. Bike paths that will take you throughout Ottawa are also easily accessible from here.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

name: Beautiful Spacious apartment, close to downtown
description: This beautiful, spacious one bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Chinatown/ Little Italy.  A perfect place to stay while visiting Ottawa. You’ll be just a short walk away from a variety of delicious restaurants and coffee shops. And a quick hop on the bus or train will bring you downtown in minutes.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of Chinatown and Little Italy. It’s just a short walk to all the amazing food, bubble tea and coffee.

Take a walk down Somerset street and you’ll find an amazing selection of the best Chinese, Korea, Vietnamese, Thai and/or Indian food in the city!

Take a walk down Preston Street and you can find a variety of small restaurants, some gelato or some beers at the pub.

Head down to Dow’s lake to enjoy a skate on the canal in the winter. Check out the tulips in the spring or just enjoy a walk by the water.

If you’re headed to Ottawa for bluesfest or another festival at Lebreton Flats, our Airbnb is the perfect spot to stay.

name: Century-Old Doctor's Office
description: This apartment used to be a doctor's office about one hundred years ago. It's a tight, well-appointed and cute space that's only a block off Richmond Road in Westboro neighbouring Equator Coffee, steps from MEC, Cupcake Lounge, Gezellig, Dairy Queen, Freshii and so much more like Superstore and Westboro Beach.  Buses 50 & 11 stop steps away, and there's a parking spot if you need.
neighborhood_overview: Trendy Westboro is full of great restaurants, coffee shops, sports stores and Lululemon, it's easy to cycle around in good weather, and you don't have to walk far to find the everyday essentials. The walk-up apartment is only one block off of Richmond Road - which is the main street for Westboro.
host_about:
Traveling from Montréal & originating from Vancouver - I seek mountains, forests, wildlife, big views, waves, sunsets, the up north, architecture, great food & great people.  

Traveling is like a sport for me.  I like extremes - I've slept in a hammock alone on an isolated Caribbean island beach for 5 days - catching fish and eating coconuts to get by - I also enjoy all the luxuries..

I travel a lot & my family is from all over the world.

description:

It is a 2-bedroom townhouse with 1.5 shared Bathrooms, a Kitchen and a living room.

host_about:

name: Beautiful 2 bedroom with Outdoor Space and Parking
description: Beautiful, newly renovated two bedroom with parking on a quiet residential street with backyard space and an outdoor patio. Perfect for families and business travellers. Your get away in Canada's capital. A bright and spacious 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom first floor apartment in a safe neighbourhood. 8 minute drive to downtown which is buzzing with farmers markets to Canadian made cheese, maple syrups and beaver tails. Walking distance to grocery stores, restaurants, pubs and much more.
neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.
host_about:
I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I have been an Airbnb host now for over 9 years. I love interacting with my guests and ensuring they're happy in their space. 

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.

minimum 30 days reservation required. some rooms locked depends on the reservation
neighborhood_overview:
Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

Located in the Civic Hospital area and minutes away from the historic experimental farm. The farm is a great location to walk or ride bikes and serves as the most beautiful scenic route to downtown as you pass Dow’s lake and the Rideau canal.

This is an ideal location since it allows one to have excellent access to Centretown just minutes away but also allows you to enjoy other arguably better parts of the city which reflect more on its character and offerings.

Hintonburg is a hip little neighbourhood with great social spots and is located just minutes away. East of Hintonburg is Little Italy. Both have excellent restaurants, cafes and bars.

The home also has great access to the Glebe neighbourhood, Bank street, and Landsdowne Park, Rideau canal.
host_about:
Hello, 

We are a young family with kids. 

Sharing our home with people from all over the world has been a unique and rewarding experience.

name: The Hideaway: quiet & private guest apartment
description:
Fantastic location! Elgin Street, Parliament Hill & Rideau Canal at your door step.

Furnished & equipped 1 bedroom.

Newly renovated

-Living room, kitchen, study & dining area with exposed brick.
- New fully equipped kitchen with quality dinner, bar & cook ware.
-Bathroom with large walk in shower.
-Bedroom with queen bed & luxury linens, full wall built in wardrobe
-Washer & dryer.
-Dedicated internet & security system
- Loblaws, LCBO, cleaners, stores & restaurants blocks away.
neighborhood_overview:
Fantastic location! The Golden Triangle is a small central district known for lively pubs, high-end restaurants, and cafes along its main strip, Elgin Street. The area is also home to several embassies and the Ottawa City Hall complex, with a plaza and pop-up ice-skating rink out front. Leafy Minto Park offers benches and picnic tables, while a paved cycling and walking path lines the Rideau Canal, which borders the neighbourhood.

One of the biggest attractions is the Rideau Canal. Here, you can walk, bike, and skate during the winter. With walking and bike paths and benches, the Canal is a great place to get exercise, and meet other members of the community. In close proximity, you will also find Elgin Street, the National Arts Centre, and the Rideau Centre. You can walk home from the Jazz Festival, Winterlude, or Canada Day festivities. This neighbourhood offers great restaurants and pubs, several parks, and a community centre complete with a pool and tennis courts.
host_about: I love to travel and to host guests from around the world.

host_about:
Welcome to our cozy home in Ottawa west centretown! This unit is on second floor of the duplex house with completely separated entrance. The unit has two bedrooms, one bath, and kitchen with In-Unit laundry and central air conditioner. Driveway can fit in 3 mid-size SUV. 
Few minutes walking to grocery stores, restaurants, pharmacies and public transit station. 350m away from main street of Chinatown, 500m away from Little Italy. Route 11 & 14 can take you to the Parliament Hill and downtown Ottawa. 550 m to reach westbound 417 highway entrance. 
We are open to monthly rental! Ideal home for newcomers to stay before finding your own place in Ottawa. 2.3km away from Service Canada/Service Ontario/City of Ottawa.
As three boys hockey parents, we know what travel means! This place will make you feel like home.

In the winter months, access to the Rideau Canal Skateway is 5 minutes away!
neighborhood_overview:
There is a great casual dining restaurant with a bar, and a few fast food establishments within a 2 minute walk, as well as a couple of convenience stores and a gas station. There is your choice of at least 3 grocery stores, all less than a 6 minute drive away and a drug store just down the street.

Mooney's Bay Park & Beach is a short drive away - or a 30 minute walk - on the other side of the river. In addition to a great beach, the park also boasts having one of the largest playgrounds in Canada! You can stop and take a stroll around the popular Hog's Back Falls on your way. From there or Mooney's Bay Park one can access the bike/walking path that follows the Rideau Canal, which is designated as a World Heritage site by UNESCO, all the way downtown. There's also a lovely walking/running trail very close to us.
host_about: I am a retired community/home visit nurse and my husband, Steve, retired after 44 years working in the field of property management. We love to travel! We have stayed in many wonderful Airbnb accommodations and are excited to offer an exceptional Airbnb experience to our guests.

name: 5* Apartment, mins from Airport, EY Centre, Casino
description: A unique loft in a rural setting, right in the city of Ottawa. Surrounded by farmers' fields, yet only 7 minutes to the airport & EY Centre, 20 minutes to downtown, 4 mins to the casino, golf, hiking & biking trails. A rustically appointed repurposed airport hangar with rounded ceilings. View brilliant sunsets from the balcony & exercise your pet on the expansive property. Find every amenity such as a workspace, HS internet, AC, & pantry essentials. Retreat to an experience in the country.
neighborhood_overview:
This private apartment is located in a relaxed, country setting, just outside the city of Ottawa. The two acre, property is surrounded by farmland where dogs can run free. There is hiking nearby, in addition to the Osgoode-Leitrim Pathway which can be used for biking, strolling or cross-country skiing. Falcon Ridge Golf Course is a two minute drive down the road. Continue a minute further and you will arrive at the Hardrock Casino and Racetrack. Two local communities, Riverside South and Findlay Creek are both a five minute drive. Both have grocery stores, a variety of shops, restaurants, and park land.
Winterlude is around the corner. From February 2 to 19, Ottawa and Gatineau will be bustling with a host of indoor and outdoor activities that showcase Indigenous culture, Canadian diversity and significant anniversaries. You won't want to miss it!
Coming this Spring...Ottawa Light Rail Transit station, less than 1 km away. Take the train right downtown to the Byward Market.
host_about: Mother to Katie, 21 and Nathan, 19, wife of 24 years to Dan, Vice Principal, teacher...almost retiree. Lived in Australia twice, for a year at a time, on teacher exchanges. Love to travel, decorate, scuba dive, garden and cottage. Building a rental cottage in Quebec. Just joined a home exchange website. Looking forward to meeting our guests from all over the globe and hearing their stories!

name: Charming downtown heritage home
description: Heritage home located in the heart of downtown Ottawa. Walking distance to several attractions (including the Byward Market, Parliament, Art Gallery, etc.), as well as just a short drive to Gatineau Park, this is the perfect spot to call home during your stay in the capital. Though built in 1897, the space is updated. Escape the busy city in our quiet oasis! Enquire about parking, we can sometimes accommodate small vehicles.
neighborhood_overview: Semi located in convenient Lowertown, a protected historic site in the heart of the city. Our home is on a large street with two parks. It is quiet and neighbours are embassies and long-term residents, several with families.
host_about: I have been hosting for a few years now, but also love to travel and explore new spaces! I have a young son. I work at the House of Commons and love what I do. I am very active and enjoy the outdoors, skiing in the winter and running in the summer!

name: Beautiful & Bright Guest Suite in Westboro
description: Guest suite is a fully private basement unit of a brand new home with 8ft ceilings. Amenities include a fully furnished kitchen including dishwasher and coffee maker, radiant floor heating, air conditioning, 60" TV, high speed wifi, toiletries, washer and dryer. The living room provides a comfortable couch, air mattress and pack n play are also available for additional sleeping space. Walking distance to lots of cafes/restaurants, 10 minute walk to the Ottawa River & 5 minute drive to downtown.
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in Wellington West/Westboro with so much within walking distance including many restaurants and cafes, local shops, three grocery stores and an LCBO. You can walk to the Ottawa River in 10-15 minutes to enjoy water activities and a beautiful sunset. Downtown Ottawa is a 5 minute drive away (or 10 minutes on the LRT).

name: Thousand Owls Estate - your resort oasis in Ottawa
description: Welcome to Thousand Owls Estate - your own private resort oasis in Ottawa!  This home sits on a private 10-acre property and features a heated indoor pool, a hot tub, a sauna, a solarium, a movie theatre room, and three separate games rooms featuring ping-pong, air hockey, shuffleboard, a pool table, a poker table, a dart board, video games, board games and much more.  These amenities can all be enjoyed year-round making Thousand Owls Estate the perfect vacation spot for any season.
neighborhood_overview:
There is so much to do at Thousand Owls Estate that guests will not want to leave. However should you be looking for other things to do during your stay, the house is conveniently located less than a 30-minute drive to downtown Ottawa and all of the city?s amenities. The communities of Cumberland and Rockland are also only 5 minutes away and offer many great restaurants, shopping, golf courses and other activities for the whole family to enjoy.

At Thousand Owls Estate, you can enjoy a private resort-like experience with only your family and friends and make memories to cherish for a lifetime!
host_about:
We (Erin & Mike Copeland) live in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada with our two young children. We are avid travelers and have visited many beautiful places around the world. When Covid hit and we were not able to travel, we looked to find a beautiful vacation spot closer to home where we could still enjoy quality time with family and friends while making long-lasting memories. 

Welcome to Thousand Owls Estate - your own private resort oasis in Ottawa! This home sits on a private 10-acre property and boasts over 5,000 square feet of living space, featuring a heated indoor heated pool, a hot tub, a sauna, a solarium, a movie theatre room, a home gym, and three separate games rooms featuring ping-pong, air hockey, pool tables, a poker table, a dart board, video games, board games and much more. These amenities can all be enjoyed year-round making Thousand Owls Estate the perfect vacation spot for any season.

name: Luxury in the Heart of the Glebe & Rideau Canal
description: Discover this exciting executive development, nestled along the Rideau Canal at Lansdowne Park in the heart of Ottawa's historic Glebe neighbourhood. Tastefully decorated with modern furnishings and amenities, enjoy panoramic views overlooking the canal, and fabulous restaurants and bars. Minutes away from the city’s vibrant downtown district, parliament buildings, excellent shopping, fine dining, and easy access to Gatineau Park for hiking, mountain biking, snow shoeing and skiing.
neighborhood_overview: Our condo is located in one of the city’s most vibrant areas! You’ll be steps away from parks and ponds, walking and biking paths along the canal that whisk you down to parliament or up to Hog’s Back Falls. Rent Stand Up Paddle boards, canoes, or kayaks a short walk away at Dow’s Lake; have a picnic in the Arboretum or stroll through the tulip festival across from the lake in spring. Skate on the world’s longest rink right in your own backyard! Don’t feel like cooking? You’re a 5 minute walk to several well- known restaurants all within Lansdowne, where you’ll see the Aberdeen Pavilion, home to the Sunday farmers’ market pretty much year round. Wander down Bank Street to discover quaint boutique shopping, grocery stores, cafes, pubs, and many more restaurants of various cuisine types. There’s always something to do in the Glebe!
host_about: I'm a retired teacher who enjoys  entertaining, traveling and getting outdoors. My husband and I love to cycle the Ottawa river paths, hike in the Gatineau hills near our home, and paddle the back country lakes of Ontario. We also enjoy the many local pubs and restaurants, art galleries, concerts and other live events in our vibrant city.

description: You will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally located place. Singles, couples, families, groups of friends anything goes when staying here. Downtown and Centertown are close and easily accessible through driving(5mins), waking(15mins), and public transportation(10mins) which is right outside.

name: 103 Acre Woods Marlborough Forest The Cedars
description: Get away from it all when you stay under the stars. Camping at the 103 Acre woods is part of the Marlborough Forest. It has groomed pathways in the meadow and rustic pathways through the woods for your hiking pleasure. Stunning night sky as there is very little light polution. Plenty of birds and nature here. Simply Paradise!
neighborhood_overview:
Camping at the 103 Acre woods is part of the Marlborough Forest. It has groomed pathways in the meadow and rustic pathways through the woods for your hiking pleasure. If you are interested in backwoods camping, it's easy to do here, park your car in the driveway, grab your gear, and head to the back forty!

I only list 2 sites for camping so you will have plenty of space and privacy from any other campers. Lots of space to spread out and have your privacy. If you want complete privacy, reserve both sites! (The Cedars & 103 Paces)

If you are staying in an RV, you can park in the driveway and still access all the other parts of the property. Tent campers can select anywhere they want to pitch a tent and enjoy the beauty of the 103 Acre woods. Depending on where you choose to camp, you might be able to drive right up to your site.

Firepit and wood available for use providing there is no burn ban. Water from the hose attached to the house is available for
host_about: Loves to be outside and spending time with my 2 chihuahuas! It’s been great sharing my yard to others who want to connect with nature. I live it every day and and so fortunate!

name: Beautiful Oasis with Great Amenities in Orleans
description: This beautiful single home in Orleans, not far from HWY174 and Innes Rd., is fully furnished/equipped and close to the beach, public transport (20-30min to downtown), a gym, restaurants, shopping, dining, family-friendly activities and so much more. The space is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and groups.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet suburban neighborhood close to shopping, restaurants, public transit and more! Downtown is ~20min drive or ~40min by public transit
host_about:
I'm a career professional living in Ottawa, Canada who is also an avid, respectful traveler and enjoy making new friends, enjoying new experiences, and sharing previous ones, with others. This allows me to broaden my horizon, gain valuable perspective, and become an overall better person.
I have a strong sense of 'home' and that is why I almost exclusively use Airbnb over hotel accommodations. I've traveled most of North America, the Caribbean, Europe, Asia as well as East Africa with endless plans to continue traveling.

description: Beautiful newly renovated one bedroom with parking on a quiet residential street. Perfect for couples, solo travellers and business travellers with an additional sofa bed for one. Located in a quiet neighbourhood with lots of free street parking. neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south of Vanier, Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh. To the east, you can find the suburb of Gloucester.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.

neighborhood_overview:
The Glebe has a strong community association which, in addition to running a large community centre, lobbies the local government on issues such as traffic calming and neighbourhood development. The Glebe has a community newspaper, Glebe Report, that has been published independently since 1973.

The Glebe is mostly populated by families; the area has many children, and consequently its social services are oriented towards youth. The Glebe lies in the federal riding of Ottawa Centre, and the same provincial electoral district.

The stretch of Bank Street that runs through the Glebe is one of Ottawa's premier shopping areas, with many small stores and restaurants offering a wide variety of services. Much of the rest of the Glebe consists of detached homes, many of them constructed in the early decades of the 20th century. Some of these homes are owner-occupied family residences, while others have been subdivided into multiple rental apartments.

The Glebe is

The Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus is just steps away, making Hintonburg an excellent option for visiting medical professionals working at the hospital.
