We are located on Henderson in SandyHill about three mins walk to uOttawa campus and University of Ottawa train station. Most desired location by uOttawa students and downtown workers. Walk to Parliament and Rideau center all about 10 mins walk. Cant beat this location. This home offers all the necessities but no luxury. you will find all you need here. This is an old Victorian home that has been updated over the years.

This room has no desk just small little tiny table with chair.

description: New Listing! Brand new build, newly furnished, located in the heart of Sandyhill. Ideal for families & working professionals. I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.

neighborhood_overview: It is the flowering season in May. This house is located in the middle of two picturesque rivers. 550 meters to the east is the adawa crossing bridge across the rideau river. Walking, listening to the singing of the river, the solo singing of the birds, the heart is suddenly calm and serene. And 950 meters to the west from the house is corktown footbridgeh across the rideau canal. You can also walk or ride on the path on both sides of the river to enjoy the city's style and natural landscape. From May to mid-August, this is located on the campus of the University of Ottawa The community is very quiet, the students have already left the school for the holiday, and the surrounding streets are suddenly free from the hustle and bustle of the past.

Hello, I'd like to give the best service for all of guests coming into our place. We provide snacks and water, and we'll make sure your room is cozy annd comfortable. 
best regards for all of you

name: Forest Suite in the City: 1bd/1bth + parking
description:
Take it easy at this unique and tranquil getaway. Located 12 mins from the airport and 18 mins from downtown, this private guest suite is attached to our family home nestled in Pinhey Forest, with access to over 5km of year-round trails.

You will have the use of your own private entrance leading to a full suite, including a fully-stocked, eat-in kitchen; 4-piece bath, queen bedroom with closet space, and a bright and cozy living room with smart TV. On-site parking is included.

description:
This stylish place to stay is perfect for group trips.

Brand New modern built Luxurious 4 bedroom Full house with Versace bedding , 8 Minute drive to Bayward Market and Parliament Hill , 3 Full bathroom California King Bed with 2 Giants TVs Full finished basement ,and huge green yard backing into a park
Large patio
ideal for hosting your family and friends. Modern kitchen with Professional Series stainless steel appliances with lots of storage and a large pantry and Free parking .
neighborhood_overview:
On the edge of the ByWard Market, The Shaw Centre , Rideue Centre , Parliment Hill, University of Ottawa and all the attractions, The Condo benefits from an ideal LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION

The extravagant redevelopment of Rideau Centre, along with ByWard Market’s unique array of specialty shops and fashion boutiques makes for a world class shopping experience.

Furthermore, a few steps away from your lobby, is the center of the city’s thriving creative scene, with exhibitions from the top local and world-renowned artists showcased right in your neighbourhood.

Quaint cafes and patisseries give ByWard Market an old time charm, while the city’s top-rated fine dining establishments and chic cocktail lounges provide the luxe contemporary feel of urban life. Endless culinary variety is yours as every type of cuisine offers up a new cultural experience.

name: Big room in a family house on Beechwood
description:
This is a spacious room with access to little backyard in our family house on a centrally located and a safe street in New Edinburgh. Free street parking. Grocery store, coffee shops and bus stop in two min walking distance, Gatineau Park 20 min drive.

Guest bathroom is right beside your room, laundry is in the basement, and guests have access to common areas. The room is located on the first floor, kitchen and living room are on the second floor, and we live on the third floor of the house.
neighborhood_overview:
Lindenlea/New Edinburgh/Beechwood : As one of the oldest residential neighbourhood of Ottawa, the area is a sweet combination of a safe, quiet, yet lively and viable area. The neighborhood is connected to downtown Ottawa and Byward market with a 20-min walk or a short bus ride. It is also close to Montfort Hospital and other amenities around St.Laurent Boulvard.

Beechwood Avenue features small shops, local pubs, cafes, bakeries, specialty food stores, book stores, as well as basic amenities such as grocery store, dry cleaner, post office and pharmacies etc. In a ten minute walking distance in the neighbourhood, you can find beautiful and well maintained parks such as Stanley Park and Rockliffe Rockeries, Rideau Hall (Governor General's residence and its beautiful garden), walking and cycling paths, skate rinks, and tree lined old streets. There is a Farmer's market at Stanley Park in Spring and Summer on Saturdays.

It is a child and family friendly area with a l
host_about: Day time public servant, night time dream catcher, big time student. Talk to me about pottery, dance, color theory, good hikes, best cottages,  hideous make overs, food stories, and family dramas. Istanbul transplant, has been calling Canada home since 2009, lives in Ottawa with her family and friends.

name: Downtown Farmhouse Loft w parking
description: A special loft space in an original farmhouse.  Quiet, bright on 3rd floor with windows facing all 4 cardinal directions.  Located 2 blocks from the historic Rideau Canal and walking distance to Parliament Buildings, ByWard Market,  restaurants, groceries, LCBO, theaters, National Arts Center, bike paths, Museums, Hospital, Universities, Cordon Bleu. The loft is equipped with washer/dryer dishwasher, hot plate, counter top stove, all necessary kitchen items and a heated towel rack . Very cozy.
neighborhood_overview: Any direction you walk leads to interesting sites. Walk or cycle South along the picturesque historic Rideau Canal to reach Ottawa Lansdowne Park where you can attend professional sporting events, take in a movie or enjoy shopping, coffee and restaurants; in the adjacent Glebe neighborhood you will find a strip of boutiques. Further along the canal you will reach Carleton University and the Hogs Back Lock Station set in beautiful natural surroundings. In the opposite direction on Elgin Street, you will come upon many restaurants, the Museum of Nature, the Ottawa Courthouse, the National Arts Centre, the National War Memorial monument, the Parliament Buildings, and adjacent Supreme Court.  East from this location you will find the ByWard Market, National Gallery and many more site seeing, shopping, and eating opportunities.
host_about: I am a violinist, my husband works at Algonquin College.  We have been renovating this house throughout our 30 year marriage while raising 3 children.  We love to cook, garden, socialize and visit family in Italy and Holland.

name: Central Ottawa Apartment w/ Parking
description: This beautiful apartment (with one on-site parking space included) is situated between three of Ottawa's trendiest neighbourhoods (Little Italy, Chinatown, and the Glebe). Walking distance from Hintonburg, Lebreton Flats (Bluesfest), Dow’s Lake (Tulip Festival), the Arboretum and the Rideau Canal. neighborhood_overview:
New Edinburgh is a neighbourhood in Rideau-Rockcliffe Ward, in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located to the northeast of the downtown core. It is bordered on the west by the Rideau River, to the north by the Ottawa River, to the south by Beechwood Avenue, and on the east by Springfield Road and the former Rockcliffe Park village limits.[1]

The area is an older, affluent neighbourhood. The Governor General of Canada's large residence and grounds are located in New Edinburgh, as is 24 Sussex Drive, official residence of the Prime Minister of Canada.

The neighbourhood is home to several embassies and consulates, including those of Spain, South Africa, France, India, Vietnam, and Slovakia. Civil servants (in particular, employees of the nearby Global Affairs Canada) compose a fair portion of the population. Like Rockcliffe Park, the neighbourhood is largely English-speaking, in comparison to the French-speaking district of Vanier to the south.

neighborhood_overview:
Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a residential neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa, Canada. It is a relatively quiet and peaceful community, consisting mainly of single-family homes and townhouses.

The neighbourhood is bordered by St. Laurent Boulevard to the west, the Aviation Parkway to the east, Ogilvie Road to the north, and the Queensway to the south. It is situated in close proximity to several amenities, including shopping centers, restaurants, parks, and schools.

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is also well-connected to public transportation, with several bus routes running through the area, providing easy access to other parts of the city. It is a diverse neighbourhood with a mix of residents from different cultural backgrounds. Overall, Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a family-friendly neighbourhood that offers a comfortable and convenient lifestyle.

description:
Centrally located & spacious 2 bedroom Apt in Ottawa’s historic & desirable Downtown Glebe neighborhood. This cozy, inviting space is perfect for couples, family or business travelers. Walk to everything! Steps from Lansdowne, TDPlace & Canal. Surrounded by Ottawa’s top restaurants, shops, parks & bike trails.

- WiFi High Speed Internet

neighborhood_overview:
My Apartment is located in the Downtown Glebe, a local, hip and nostalgic neighbourhood bustling with local businesses and an irresistible trendy vibe.

It is on a quiet residential street yet very close to everything, including parliament/byward market. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums - all nearby.

Steps to Lansdowne Park/TD Place Stadium if your coming to watch your favorite sports team. Lansdowne Park features everything from relaxation to recreation. Landsdowne Park is a must see destination for tourists, a hub to connect neighbourhoods, a quite oasis, a destination for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It has something to offer for everyone to enjoy.

Steps to the Canal - beautiful trail for a morning run and a refreshing bike ride. Make sure to check out the Byward Market and Parliament in downtown core, minutes away!
host_about: I am a corporate lawyer that loves to travel and spend time with family and friends. Now I am hosting in my own city and my objectif is to ensure that all my guest experience such an unforgettable stay & to share with them all the gems of this beautiful City.

name: Ottawa's 7-BED/4-BATH Modern Home - 2021 NEW BUILD
description:
Less than 14 minutes away from Downtown Ottawa, this newly built 2021 modern and open concept townhome comfortably accommodates large groups.

It is close to many amenities such as Movati, Landmark Cinemas, Walmart, Canadian Tire, Moxies, Lonestar, and much more.

This home includes 7 beds, 4 bedrooms, 3.5 bathrooms, a large breakfast bar area, a private office space, 10ft ceilings across the main floor, a warm and modern living and dinning room area, new washer and dryer, and much more.
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is a new community in the east-end of Ottawa. There are many walking distance amenities available such as Landmark Cinemas, Moxies, Lonestar Five Guys, Movati, Walmart, Lowes, Best Buy, Canadian Tire, Scotiabank, CIBC, RBC and much more.
host_about:
Hi there,

My name is George and I am from Ottawa, Ontario. :) I am a recent engineering grad that loves to travel and explore new places. I have a stayed at a number of exquisite and modern Airbnb's in the past, that I decided to join the community with my own listing, right here in the Nation's Capital. 


Born and raised here in Ottawa, I know the city inside and out and will be more than glad to answer any of your questions. I recommend the following attractions for first time visitors in the city:


1.  Visit Parliament Hill 
2. Skate on the Canal Rideau during the winter 
3.  Visit the Museum of Nature and  the Canadian War Museum
4. Take a stroll and stop by for a bite to eat in the Byward Market
5. Visit Gatineau Park


Excited to be able to host you whether you're a new traveller to my Airbnb or a returning guest. :)

Good things come in small packages! Bachelor apartment situated in Centertown, one of Ottawa's historic neighborhoods in the heart of downtown Ottawa. The ideal location for anyone interested in exploring everything the city has to offer! Ideal for couples and business travelers.

**QUEEN size bed**

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of our Nation’s capital is Centretown Ottawa which includes downtown Ottawa. From beautifully restored Victorian homes on streets canopied with mature trees to high and low-rise condos, there is something for everyone living in Centretown Ottawa.

Living in Centretown Ottawa means living right in the middle of everything: shopping, nightlife, a variety of dining establishments, and tourist attractions. You will love walking along the lovely Rideau Canal to the historic Parliament buildings, popping over to the cafes in Byward Market, shopping at the newly-renovated Rideau Centre, and seeing the many embassies that call Centretown home.

description:
Charming, self-contained guest suite in the lower level of a family home, conveniently located in the charming community of Westboro.
Suite features two cozy/comfortable bedrooms, a modern bathroom, a kitchen with laundry, and an open concept living/eating/workspace.
Decorated with warmth in a mid-century modern/vintage style.

* Important - not suitable for infants or toddlers or people with any balance or mobility issues. You must be able to safely and easily navigate flights of stairs.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the middle of a quiet street which coincidentally links up to all that Westboro has to offer.

A few steps to the South is Ottawa’s premier pedestrian main street with the best of new restaurants, pubs, specialty coffee and shopping as well as MEC and the adventure outfitting retail cluster that accompanies it. Every convenience is also there in the way of pharmacy, post office, dry cleaning, health food stores, etc. Yoga studios abound and several churches are close. The Maplelawn heritage garden and historic manor house (with restaurant - best steaks in town) are also around the corner. The Byron linear park offers a fine walk about and is filled with the tastes and smiles of the outdoor Westboro food and farmers market every Saturday May through October.

A few steps to the North and you come across the panoramic Ottawa river. Westboro beach is the best swimming spot in town, kayaks and canoes lay about with volleyball and movie nights upon occas
host_about: Working Professional.  Embrace life - there is so much to explore and enjoy! Happy to make recommendations of how to max out your stay in Ottawa! Just ask!

name: Charming Basement Apartment - Your Getaway!
description: Escape to a cozy 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom accommodation in Cumberland, a peaceful suburb of Ottawa. Enjoy internet access and modern amenities while surrounded by the stunning natural beauty of the Ottawa River, rolling hills, and mature forests. Discover the rich history of the region at the Cumberland Heritage Village Museum, & stay active. Whether for a weekend or extended stay, this idyllic retreat is perfect for relaxation and rejuvenation. Book now to experience the tranquility of Cumberland!
neighborhood_overview:
Cumberland is a historic neighborhood known for its picturesque setting and charming small-town feel. Here are some highlights about the neighborhood:

Cumberland Village is a designated heritage district, offering a unique glimpse into the region's rich history.
The neighborhood features larger lots surrounded by mature trees and forests, providing a serene and peaceful environment for residents and visitors alike.
Cumberland offers a variety of outdoor activities, including hiking, fishing, and boating, with easy access to the Ottawa River and nearby parks.
The nearby Cumberland Heritage Village Museum offers a fascinating look at the region's history and is a popular destination for tourists and locals alike.
While Cumberland is a small town, it is located just a short drive away from the suburban conveniences of Orleans, making it easy to access services and amenities.
The neighborhood is home to a tight-knit community of families and professional

name: COZY WESTBORO COTTAGE   : UPGRADED 3 BED W/ PRKING
description:
Live in the Heart of Westboro, in this Cozy, charming and FULLY RENOVATED home rooted in history.

You will find yourself on the best part of the Richmond Strip, with only a few steps to some of the city's best restaurants and shopping.

Westboro BEACH is less than 1 km away!
Enjoy biking along the parkway or a short drive to the ski slopes of the Gatineau hills.

Public transit is a stones throwaway with a short Bus / train ride into the Downtown core.

Ample driveway Parking to fit 3 cars.
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a hub of activity all year-long, but particularly during the warm weather months.

Enjoy the soft sand, water activities and spectacular sunsets at Westboro Beach on the Ottawa River.

In spring, Westboro Village welcomes all to join in a celebration of retailers during Shop the Village. All summer long, people fill the patios along the main street and shop at the Ottawa Farmers Market on Saturdays at Byron Linear Park. As the leaves change colour in the fall, look out for ghosts, spiders, skulls and more during the annual Wickedly Westboro Scavenger Hunt.

During mild weather, the recreational pathways along the Ottawa River are filled with cyclists, pole-walkers, roller-bladers and runners. In the winter, the section between Westboro and the Canadian War Museum near downtown Ottawa becomes the Kichi Sibi Winter Trail. Cross-country skiers, snowshoers, fat-bikers and walkers all use this groomed snow route. Urban nature at its best!
host_about:
I am experienced Super Host on Air Bnb.

An Interior Designer by profession.
I have a passion for the arts, music , fashion and food.

The spaces My wife ( Julianne) and I create, have a long history to them.
And as such, we take immense pride in their story.

We both love travelling and try to do so when we can get a few moments to breathe between our busy work schedules. That being said, we love to entertain, dine out and experience new things. 

We look forward to Hosting you!

description:
This is a newly built townhouse occupied by just the two of us. The house is located in the Findlay Creek neighbourhood in Ottawa South. We have meticulously made this place our own.

The bedroom has a large window with plenty of natural light. It comes with a queen size bed, side table and closet. The 3pc bathroom is located just next to the bedroom and comes with a full size bathtub and toiletries.

We also have an amazing coffee station open to the guests for that steamy brew of coffee.

name: Sleigh Room, Downtown, Second Wind Ottawa! Parking
description:
STR 844-151
A block from Elgin restaurants & boutiques, steps to the canal, close to Byward Market, Parliament, the Shaw Centre, and Lansdowne!

The Century home, with its beautiful garden and patio and excellent WIFI is set up for both work-from-home and relaxation!

Our street is quiet, yet still a short stroll to all the excitement the city has to offer.

Pamela and Judith live on site, ready to welcome you to their home.
neighborhood_overview: The Golden Triangle neighbourhood is vibrant and full of life. From restaurants, boutique shopping, the Rideau Canal, (skating in winter, paddling or canoeing in the summer) bike paths, steps from the Museum of Nature, and steps away from the Glebe neighbourhood, Centretown and the Market area of Ottawa.  During the day, this area is full of peole walking, running, biking though  and a mix of old homes, apartments, condos, while at night, people seek out the nightlife along Elgin Street with it's wide-ranging cuisine, pubs and clubs.  The perfect spot for families, (a fab park around the corner) as well as those seeking a hub to then go explore the city and beyond!
host_about:
We are Judith & Pamela!  We met years ago as neighbours working on volunteer projects around education and also environmental issues in our community.  We became good friends along the way.  

With our nests emptying, we decided to open a Bed and Breakfast, together.  Having worked with international clientele throughout our careers, hosting guests from out of town fits with our interests and lifestyle.  We have lots of plans to make our home and guest spaces a showcase for sustainable living. We are hoping our guests give us suggestions while they are with us!

Judith currently works as a supply teacher in the OCDSBoard. She also runs a house painting business, and a myriad of other smaller jobs. Pamela taught international teachers how to teach English as a second or foreign language;  now she works from home, teaching online and welcoming guests.  

The two of us will live in the apartment on the main level. You'll see us  in and out of the apartment during the day.

name: Beach Front in Constance Bay with Hot Tub
description: "Welcome to West Beach Villa! Experience serene riverside living in our charming 2.79-acre retreat along the Ottawa River. Enjoy a private 400' beach, perfect for paddle boarding, fishing & bonfires. Relax on the 50' deck with BBQ, or unwind indoors with an 75" TV featuring, Netflix & YouTube. A Book of Rules ensures a harmonious stay. Your hosts are nearby for assistance. Escape to this tranquil haven for an unforgettable getaway!"
neighborhood_overview:
Dive into the heart of serenity as you step into Constance Bay, a charming enclave nestled by the gentle Ottawa River. Our serene neighborhood extends a warm embrace to those seeking refuge in nature’s lap, away from the hustle of city life. Here, the day begins with a melodious symphony of birds at dawn and ends with the sky painting itself in hues of twilight reflected on calm waters.

Constance Bay isn’t just a stay; it’s an experience of returning to nature. Our local beach is a haven of tranquility where each wave plays along with the soft sands. It’s a perfect spot for long, reflective strolls, playful family days under the sun, or a serene reading spot with the rhythm of waves as your companion. For the trail-lovers, verdant pathways await to be explored, each turning revealing the simplistic elegance and wonder of woodland realms.

The spirit of community runs deep in Constance Bay's veins. Local diners serve a palette of homely flavors, encapsulating the es

name: Adorable 3 Bdrm House Deck - Nepean
description:
Make some memories at this unique and family-friendly place. This 3 bedroom house in Nepean has three spacious rooms, two full bathrooms, a jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom, and an outdoor dinning table. Our safe and friendly neighborhood make it the perfect place for small gatherings or family outings. About 30 mins away from the Nordik spa, and 15 mins away from downtown Ottawa.

*please note there is a separate 2 bdrm basement apartment with no shared rooms except laundry area.
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in a very quiet, luscious, and safe area of Nepean, Ottawa. Although it is 2 minutes from one of the busiest intersections of Ottawa, this neighbourhood is a quiet gem full of trees, gardens, flowers, and spacious properties - making it a relaxing getaway in the middle of the city!
host_about:
I am a young professional who has worked in the travel and entertainment industry for over 12 years.  I've traveled to over 32 countries and explored my own city in great depth!

Although I respect that some people enjoy their time alone, I am a social butterfly who loves food, the outdoors, and exploring cafes - so feel free to ask me for recommendations regarding your time in Ottawa or chat with me if we run into each other during your stay!

name: Modern Room | Free Parking | Trainyards Riverview
description:
Welcome home. This all-inclusive room in Riverview Park is full of amenities.

A double bed, built-in closet, office desk and chair, blackout window blinds, as well as access to a brand new bathroom with a tub and rainfall shower await you.

Common areas are shared with the owner (young bilingual male): a bright kitchen including induction stovetop and dishwasher, modern living room with breathtaking fireplace, laundry room, and furnished patio with BBQ. Inquire directly for short-term stays.
neighborhood_overview:
This sunny end-unit is nestled in a quiet project surrounded by mature trees and 2-story tall cedar hedges in Riverview Park.

- Trainyards mall, coffee shops, and groceries = 2 minutes by car, 10 by foot
- Ottawa General / CHEO / Roger Guindon Hall = 5 minutes by car, 20 by foot, 5 by bike
- Lynda Lane Park = 5 minutes by car, 20 by foot
- Via Rail train and bus station = 5 minutes by car
- uOttawa = 25 minutes by public transportation, 10 by bike
- Saint Paul University = 30 minutes by public transportation, 10 by bike
host_about:
Hi there!

My name is Alex and I’m a BBA grad. 

Hobbies I enjoy include working out, cooking for my friends and family, skiing and, of course, being your host on Airbnb.

As your devoted host, may I help my guests create everlasting memories, one stay at a time... Let's make yours a reality!
____________________________________________________

Bonjour!

Mon nom est Alex et je suis diplômé d'un BAA.

Certains de mes passe-temps incluent: m'entraîner, cuisiner pour ma famille et mes amis, skier les magnifiques pentes du Mont-Tremblant et, bien sûr, être votre hôte sur Airbnb.

En tant qu’hôte dévoué, j’espère sincèrement pouvoir être le véhicule permettant à mes invités de créer de souvenirs mémorables, un séjour à la fois… Faisons du vôtre une réalité !

description:

Welcome to The Sunset suite, a professionally cleaned 1 Bedroom Suite that is centrally located in Ottawa. Steps away from VIA rail central train station and the LRT subway station. Only 3km away from downtown Ottawa: the Rideau Canal, Byward market and Parliament Hill.

The home has been tastefully redecorated with a mix of modern and bohemian theme. It is located in a quiet, secure area and adjacent to a city park where there are tennis & basketball courts.

• 1 min to TrainYards shops
• 3 min to St-Laurent shopping centre
• 9 min to Westboro village
• 9 min to Lansdowne park (home to the Ottawa Redblacks)
• 5 min to University of Ottawa
• 16 min to Ottawa International Airport
• 8 min to Montfort hospital
• 20 min to CTC (home to the Ottawa Senators)
• 20 min to Gatineau park hiking trails and Nordik Spa

Located within a walking distance to bus stops, the LRT subway station and VIA rail. Guests can park their car for free at the home and explore Ottawa’s diverse neighbourhoods and festivities like BluesFest in the summer, as well as the tulip festival in the spring. name: Beautiful 3-Bedroom House | Centretown | 2 Parking
description:
Enjoy a bright and beautiful single-family house centrally located steps away from dozens of delicious restaurants in Chinatown/Little Italy and Ottawa's main attractions.
Designed with lots of love and passion with a beautiful open concept with unique modern custom finishes. The house is equipped with everything you need!
You can easily park 2 cars in the driveway at the side of the house.
neighborhood_overview: The house is steps away from two main streets where you can easily access Ottawa's best restaurants and tourist attractions. There is a public park right around the corner and the area is very family friendly. A quick 5 minute Uber downtown or if it's a nice day you can get to Parliament in only 25 minutes by foot! Get some bubble tea or a nice hot bowl of Pho just steps away. Maybe you have a late night pizza craving there's a pizza place just a few meters away!

My favourite quote is "action is the antidote to despair".

name: Downtown , Landsdowne Canal living
description:
Laid back cozy, central canal living. Walk along the canal to Landsdowne, Parliament, the Rideau Centre and Elgin Street. Shopping, museums, restaurants and bars are minutes away. Or bring your SUP, kayak or canoe and explore the historic Rideau Canal on the water. There is a public dock steps away. Kayak in the summer and skating in the winter!!!!
Old Ottawa East is a family friendly hip neighborhood. You have found the perfect location to explore Ottawa!!
neighborhood_overview: Old Ottawa East is one of Ottawa’s best kept secrets.    Hip, family friendly and central.   Walking, hiking, biking on the canal is at your doorstep.   Don’t forget about Skating on  the worlds largest skating rink which is a few short steps away.    The more adventurous can SUP, canoe and kayak on the canal.
host_about: I love sports and especially squash, golf and wake surfing and wake skating.   I like to fish and relax at the cottage, travel in the winter.

name: Charming Glebe Home with backyard
description:
Permit # STR 827-478

Welcome to our home in the heart of the trendy Glebe! The Glebe is Ottawa's finest downtown neighbourhood. You will be close to everything when you stay including shops, restaurants, the Rideau Canal and Lansdowne Park. Visit Ottawa and stay in this 3 bedrooms, 1.5 bathrooms home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of the Glebe, an established centuries-old area of Ottawa. A very hip neighbourhood lined by beautiful Victorian-style homes with diverse amenities including boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, cinemas, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs. You are a five-minute walk to the scenic Rideau Canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.

We have easy access to public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) that will take you to Parliament Hill in ten minutes. The Lansdowne development (a two-minute walk) has brought a new vibe to our neighbourhood with trendy restaurants, green space with a skatepark, play structures, a WholeFoods grocery store and a modern theatre built around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), Atlético Ottawa (CPL) and the Ottawa Sixty Sevens (AHL). Our location
host_about: Originally from France, I moved to Canada few years ago for work and stay for love. I lived in many countries: Sweden, India, China, Thailand, and the UK. I enjoy meeting new people from all over the world. I hope I will meet you soon!

description: Relax and play with your family and friends at our peaceful country villa. 4 bedrooms, 3 full bathrooms, game room and heated indoor pool and infrared sauna. A perfect retreat for your extended stay. Located on 2 acres of private and rural luxury but only minutes to hwy 7 at Upper Dwyer Hill. neighborhood_overview:
Perfect located between Stittsville, Ashton and Richmond on a 2 acres private lot, surrounded by equestrian farms and golf courses.

Our Ashton Villa location offers many options for entertainment at very short distance such as Canadian Tire Centre (10 mins), Professional Golf courses (from 5 mins walk up to 20 minutes drive, we are located in the perfect golfer paradise location).

Our cottage retreats are situated about an hour away from Ottawa. 
We also have a couple long term rentals in Nepean and 2 luxury high-end long-term rentals with pools, one in Nepean and the other is located in the Stittsville and Ashton area. Please check all our listings.

name: Exquisite 2 bed, 1.5 bath @ Quinespointe Barrhaven
description: Welcome to new community at Quinespoint in Barrhaven! This charming end unit townhouse features 2 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms and is located in a quiet neighborhood close to schools, public playground and tennis court, shopping and bus routes. Pets friendly! No smoking or PARTIES! Large single car garage. Stunning kitchen with panty, fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave/hoodfan and breakfast bar. Private balcony off living and dining room. Air conditioning, internet, and all the comforts of home!
neighborhood_overview: Barrhaven is a suburb of Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located about 17 km (11 mi) southwest of the city's downtown core.  South of this is the area known as Longfields, which stretches south to Strandherd and east to Woodroffe Avenue. Sandwiched between the railway tracks, Jockvale Road, Greenbank and Strandherd is the neighbourhood of Barrhaven on the Green. East of Woodroffe, next to the Rideau River, is the neighbourhood of Davidson Heights. South of Strandherd and east of Greenbank is a new community known as Chapman Mills.
host_about: Fun-loving dad of two handsome boys, easy going and husband to a beautiful wife.

name: Ottawa Mini Loft Suite -A Couples Escape
description:
Take it easy at this small but unique and tranquil getaway mini loft for two. A couple can enjoy a private hot tub and BBQ in the outdoor space or bring it indoors. Free street parking for all guests.

Barrhaven is a suburb of Ottawa, Ontario. It is located about 17 km (20-25mins) southwest of the downtown Ottawa, Gatineau and Lac Leamy Casino by car! Barrhaven has a lot of parks, trails, restaurants, bars, cafe's, and shopping in the area.
neighborhood_overview:
You’ll find multiple spots to shop in Barrhaven including Barrhaven Town Centre, Chapman Mills Marketplace, Strandherd Crossing and Barrhaven Mall. Shops include spots like Winners, Carter’s OshKosh, Plato’s closet and more! Plenty of grocery stores including Costco or more boutique shops for all your groceries.

Many pubs and restaurants in the area. Pubs and restaurants include Heart & Crown, Barley Mow, Greenfields, Broadways, Royal Oak, The Jolly Taxpayer Bar & Grill, Brown’s Socialhouse, Montana’s, Lonestar, and Eastside Mario’s to name a few.

Barrhaven has lots of parks and trails to explore. At the different parks you’ll find splash pads, soccer fields, forest trails, bike trails, wide open spaces perfect for a picnic and more.

Location is second to none. Beechwood village and Rockcliffe Park is the pinnacle of ottawa. Easy commute to downtown. Wonderful cafes
and bike trails on your doorstep!
neighborhood_overview:
Beechwood village is directly adjacent to historic Rockcliffe park and New Edinburgh. Full of great coffee shops, boutiques, dining - this really is a bustling area that’s only getting more and more amenities.

The building is close to the hustle and bustle of the village, but far enough that it gives you peace and quiet. An easy walk or bike ride can bring you to some of the most aesthetic parks and buildings in Ottawa, such as Stanley Park, Rideau River, and the Prime Ministers Residence - or, take you on a great night out!

Just west of the Glebe and walking distance to Little Italy and Dow's Lake, enjoy stunning sunsets from the 39th floor balcony.  This space will uplift and energize you!
neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Little Italy. You will enjoy walking to first class restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques on Preston street. This allows for that urban lifestyle with green space for tranquility - truly a gem of a spot. Walking distance to Civic hospital and 5 minute drive to the Glebe.

We would love for you to enjoy our stays as we continue to add more in amazing Urban Canadian cities.

name: Charming Private Bedroom & Bathroom in Centertown
description:
Stay in our cozy home in the center of Canada's capital. The second floor is yours: a private bedroom with a walk-in closet and access to your own full bathroom. Access to the kitchen is welcome.
This place is ideal for travellers who want to discover everything Ottawa offers. Close to the great attractions and all the embassies.
We have many recommendations we can share that will make your stay memorable.
neighborhood_overview:
We love the area we live in, easily walkable to all the points of interest and very bike-friendly. Ottawa is a beautiful green city in the Summer with many gorgeous parks and sites to see. Notably, you will have:
Bank street (5 min walk away) you will find little shops going down into the Glebe and often closed for street events.
Chinatown (a 5-minute walk), get some great food nearby.
Ottawa River pathway, War Memorial Museum and Ottawa river dam (10-minute walk) beautiful pathways with stunning architecture to see.
Parliament Hill (15 min walk away)
Little Italy (15-minute walk)
Elgin St. (15-minute walk) has great restaurants and bars.
Rideau Canal (20-minute walk), rent some bikes and tour the city in style.
Byward Market (25-minute walk), awesome nightlife with many bars and restaurants

name: Cozy basement room in a family house on Beechwood
description:
This is a bright basement room in our centrally located family home in New Edinburgh, a safe walkable residential neighborhood. Free street parking, two min to grocery store, coffee shops, and bus stop. 20 min drive to Gatineau Park. Very close to embassies, 15 min to downtown core and Ottawa U.
The room has a queen bed, desk, and closet space. Guest bathroom is one floor upstairs on the first floor. Kitchen and living room are on the second floor, and we live on the third floor of the house.
neighborhood_overview:
Lindenlea/New Edinburgh/Beechwood : As one of the oldest residential neighbourhood of Ottawa, the area is a sweet combination of a safe, quiet, yet lively and viable area. The neighborhood is connected to downtown Ottawa and Byward market with a 20-min walk or a short bus ride. It is also close to Montfort Hospital and other amenities around St.Laurent Boulvard.

Beechwood Avenue features small shops, local pubs, cafes, bakeries, specialty food stores, book stores, as well as basic amenities such as grocery store, dry cleaner, post office and pharmacies etc. In a ten minute walking distance in the neighbourhood, you can find beautiful and well maintained parks such as Stanley Park and Rockliffe Rockeries, Rideau Hall (Governor General's residence and its beautiful garden), walking and cycling paths, skate rinks, and tree lined old streets. There is a Farmer's market at Stanley Park in Spring and Summer on Saturdays.

name: Elegant 3 Bdrm 4 beds home  w/ 2 Free Parking
description:
Welcome to our beautifully decorated 3 bedroom townhouse located in a family-friendly neighbourhood! Our property is perfect for families, groups of friends, and anyone looking for a comfortable and relaxing stay.

(sleeps 7 + 2 free parking spots). Located near restaurants, shops, golf course, Casino and more. 65” TV, fastest internet (1.5 Gbps fibe), dedicated workspace, Italian made leather sofas surrounded w/ stylish decor. 9 mins away from airport - 22 mins away from DT Ottawa.
neighborhood_overview: Family oriented and safe neighbourhood with many parks, skating rink, basketball court, soccer field, golf range and batting range,  nice walking trails and more. Located near many restaurants, shoppers drug mart, freshco, nail salon, hair dresser, barber shop, RBC, CIBC bank, Tim Hortons, Starbucks, Casino and LCBO.
host_about:
Hey ya! My name is Hussein. I’m just a guy who likes to create cool stuff.  I love to travel and discover new places and different cultures. I've stayed in Airbnb's all over the world and always get inspiration from the places I visit. A home can say a lot about a person without even having to meet in person. Neatness and cleanliness is a must, call it OCD if you like, I call it perfectionism.

My favourite things in the world are trees and the wood they produce, photography and of course food. I especially love the outdoors and camping. Oh, and I love coffee!

My property, which I have furnished and decorated with style, is situated in a fantastic Ottawa neighbourhood. As a host, I can't wait to show fellow travellers the same great hospitality I have received all around the globe.

neighborhood_overview:
Blackburn Hamlet has rural areas and several older and newer settlement areas. The lands form part of Ottawa's "Greenbelt" and provide Blackburn Hamlet residents and visitors with over 250 km of hiking and cross-country skiing trails.

Ottawa is Canada’s capital, east of southern Ontario, near Montréal and the U.S. border. Sitting on the Ottawa River, it has at its centre Parliament Hill, with grand Victorian architecture and museums such as the National Gallery of Canada, with noted collections of indigenous and other Canadian art. The park-lined Rideau Canal is filled with boats in summer and ice skaters in winter.

Traditionally the ByWard Market (in Lower Town), Parliament Hill and the Golden Triangle (both in Centretown – Downtown) have been the focal points of the cultural scenes in Ottawa. name: Beautiful bungalow in heart of Westboro
description:
This home is located in the heart of Westboro. It’s an older home with lots of charm. It has been renovated throughout. If you know the Danish term “Hygge” this is what this home represents.
Sit back relax curl up on the sofa with a cup of coffee and a cozy blanket. Or watch a movie on Netflix with a bowl of pop corn. Kitchen is well equipped with blender, food processor etc. There are also many great restaurants and boutiques within walking distance. Bus to downtown is half a block away.
neighborhood_overview: Westboro is a thriving community.  You can do as much or as little as you want.  Plenty of restaurants and boutiques within walking distance.  There is a wonderful market on Saturday until the end of October.  3 major grocery stores within a few minutes walk.  Superstore,  Farmboy and Metro.  LCBO is only 2 blocks away.
host_about:
Hi! My name is Eva and I’ve been living in this home for over 10 years.  I love the neighborhood and my neighbours.  I can’t imagine not living within walking distance to just about everything.  
I was born in Denmark, immigrated to Canada many years ago.  Canada is my home ♥️

name: 2-bed 2-bath 2-floor apartment in Centertown
description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: Only available between November 2024 and May 2025. Minimum 90-days required. Check-in/check-out dates flexible.

2-floor, 2-bed, 2-bath heritage apartment is fully-furnished and features one parking spot, original hardwood floors and high ceilings. Located in Ottawa’s Centertown neighbourhood, close to many amenities such as coffee shops, grocery stores, yoga/fitness studios, and is walking distance to main public transit routes, major tourist destinations, and embassies.
neighborhood_overview:
Centretown offers several grocery stores as well as a wide variety of specialty food stores (about 28) and 23 convenience stores. In Centretown you have an opportunity to enjoy fine dining at more than 100 sit-down restaurants, as well as 148 fast food outlets when on the go. Centretown also offers four indoor recreation facilities as well as 21 sites for summer recreation and 2 sites for winter recreation.

The Canadian Museum of Nature, Dundonald Park, Jack Purcell Park, the Ottawa Curling Club and the Central Bus Station are all located in Centretown.

Other nearby areas in Ottawa's Central Walking District include Byward Market, Lindenlea, Sandy Hill and The Glebe.
host_about: I love hosting, and meeting travelers from all over the world. I enjoy helping my guests find their way around town, and plan the perfect itinerary. I hope I get a chance to do that with you!

name: Cute 1-bedroom suite steps from downtown
description:
Take in the best of Ottawa while relaxing in a newly-renovated suite in the heart of the city. Clean, modern and stylish with a comfy bed, private bathroom and living room with TV, microwave and mini-fridge.

You'll be steps from the University of Ottawa, the Rideau Canal, and historic Strathcona Park. Just a five minute walk to the O-Train, giving you easy access to everything the nation's capital has to offer. Downtown and the Byward Market are within walking distance.
neighborhood_overview:
Russell Avenue is a quiet, safe and leafy street in beautiful Sandy Hill.

Sandy Hill is home to a multicultural mix of students, families, diplomats, and newcomers. It's a vibrant, safe neighbourhood that's close to everything.

Our listing is ideal for travellers who want a quiet and safe place to stay while they visit the University of Ottawa, the Byward Market, the Rideau Canal, or Parliament Hill.
host_about:
Easy-going, and fun-loving husband/Dad on the shy side of 40 who works as a researcher, but would rather be snowboarding or playing guitar. 

If I'm applying to stay with you, chances are that I'm travelling with my wife and daughter. We like to think we're a nice young(ish) family who like to explore new places and cultures. We're also very food-driven. 

And we're hosts! Our basement suite is a comfy and clean space for visitors, and we take a lot of pride in providing people with a good experience. Our default is to leave our guests alone, but if you want to chat or have any questions, we're friendly and like meeting people. 

On parle français aussi.

ByWard Market is a buzzing hub of outdoor farmers’ market stalls and specialty food shops selling Canadian cheese and maple-infused chocolate. It’s also known for its colorful street art and hip stores filled with crafts and clothes by local designers. Surrounding eateries serve shawarma and BeaverTails (sweet fried pastries in the shape of a beaver’s tail). Nightlife encompasses rustic taverns and stylish gay bars.

Parliament hill, Rideau Centre and Rideau river are within walking distance

Welcome to the vibrant Carlington neighbourhood, your gateway to an enriching Ottawa experience during your midterm stay. Nestled in the heart of the city, Carlington offers a blend of urban convenience and natural serenity.

Explore the charming streets lined with a mix of shops, eateries, and local markets, where you can savour the local flavours and discover hidden gems. Nature enthusiasts will delight in the nearby green spaces, including Carlington Park and Experimental Farm, perfect for rejuvenating walks or picnics amidst lush surroundings.

With its strategic location, Carlington ensures easy access to key destinations like downtown Ottawa, the Civic Hospital, and numerous educational institutions. Immerse yourself in the community's friendly atmosphere and enjoy the array of cultural events, farmer's markets, and recreational facilities.

Neighbourhood description
Activities and entertainment is easily accessible within a few minutes walk.
- A couple of blocks away: 24hr large grocerie stores, pharmacies, restaurants, etc

**Wondering about safety of the neighbourhood?
The building is very safe and has a 24hr security guard like a high end luxury hotel. The building is located right in the heart of downtown and it is a very touristy area. It is recommended to always exercise adequate discretion like when travelling downtown in any metropolitan city. According to Statistics Canada, Ottawa has one of the lowest crime rates in Canada for a metropolitan area. Ottawa crime rates are well below Montreal, Toronto, Vancouver, Edmonton, Guelph, Kingston, St. John, and many others.

name: Downtown 5-Star 3-bdrm - BBQ - Backyard & Parking
description: Beautifully renovated 1930s house in the heart of Hintonburg— voted best and trendiest neighbourhood in Ottawa. (300m) to Bayview LRT station (300m), Ottawa river' (500m) bicycle paths and walkways. (5min) from Lebreton Flats site of most summer festivals, (8 min) from downtown Ottawa, Rideau Center, Parliament Hill,  Byward market, U of Ottawa. (5min) from Wellington St, Westboro, great cafés, bars, restaurants, convenience stores (150m), liquor store (150m), grocery stores etc. Rare 2 parking!
neighborhood_overview:
Arty Hintonburg's shopping and dining scene is centered on the cool boutiques, bistros, vegan cafes and coffee shops of Wellington Street West. At night, locals head to trendy supper clubs and brewpubs. The Great Canadian Theatre Company stages edgy work by local playwrights, while small galleries, studios and street murals reflect the creative atmosphere. Laroche Park hosts fairs and art events.

In its April 2007 issue, enRoute magazine named Hintonburg one of the top ten emerging neighbourhoods in Canada
host_about:
Hi there! My name is Kal, and I’ve been living here in the Ottawa-Gatineau region for over 20 years. I'm someone that many say that think out the box. I like exploring and doing things differently.

I speak English and French fluently.

I enjoy meeting new people and familiarizing myself with other cultures. I’m enthusiastic about anything new, l like playing sports and do various activities like, building furniture, designing floor plans, and any type of work that requires any physical activity. I’m obsessed with traveling – in addition to having traveled all over the US, I’ve visited over twenty countries in total in Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. 

Looking forward to meeting you! I’m confident your your stay will be comfortable and you'll enjoy this awesome centrally located neighbourhood in the city to the fullest! 

Feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions regarding my listing.

description:

neighborhood_overview:
Golden Triangle

The Golden Triangle is a small central district known for lively pubs, high-end restaurants, and cafes along its main strip, Elgin Street. The area is also home to several embassies and the Ottawa City Hall complex, with a plaza and pop-up ice-skating rink out front. Leafy Minto Park offers benches and picnic tables, while a paved cycling and walking path lines the Rideau Canal, which borders the neighbourhood.

One of the biggest attractions is the Rideau Canal. Here, you can walk, bike, and skate during the winter. With walking and bike paths and benches, the Canal is a great place to get exercise, and meet other members of the community. In close proximity, you will also find Elgin Street, the National Arts Centre, and the Rideau Centre. You can walk home from the Jazz Festival, Winterlude, or Canada Day festivities. This neighbourhood offers great restaurants and pubs, several parks, and a community centre complete with a pool and tennis courts.

name: Modern 2BR - Condo Unit - Vanier!
description:
These cozy and modern two-bedroom apartments offers all the amenities you'll need during a quick getaway - perfect for the solo traveller, couple or small families!

There are separate and private units within the building. Each of these apartments have unique decor and are freshly renovated, with new furniture and upgraded bathrooms. The living room of each apartment has a comfortable sofa to relax while watching the Smart TV that comes with Netflix.
neighborhood_overview:
These apartments are in the heart of the trendy Vanier district, with easy access to all major downtown attractions as well as Ottawa's finest restaurants, coffee shops, museums, and art galleries.

Nearby attractions include Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, Byward Market, Rideau Canal, Little Italy, China Town, all of the Museums (Canadian War Museum, National Gallery, Canadian Museum of Nature, Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Canadian Museum of History, and the Canadian Museum of Space and Aviation), Commissioner's Park, Dows Lake Pavillion, several hiking trails, the waterway (popular for kayaking), and Gatineau.

There's also Nordique spa, which is a 20-minute drive in Chelsea, Quebec. It is absolutely beautiful with thermal baths and spas. I'd highly recommend it if you're able to go!
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome guests from around the world to share our home and our love of the surrounding area. We understand how important a successful vacation is; the feelings you get like you're ready to take on the world again. You get to relax with family and friends and take a break from your usual routines, while promoting togetherness and creating shared memories of times spent together. 

It is our pleasure to help you create beautiful memories that will last a lifetime. Our reward is knowing your stay was relaxing, comfortable, and most of all memorable.

description:
Welcome! This newly RENOVATED and PROFESSIONALLY CLEANED 2 BR suite has all the amenities you need.

This unit is private with seperate entrance for your maximum comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
If you like the outdoors, you won't be disappointed. Bells Corners is known for lots of greens, nature trails, and quietness.

When leaving the driveway, turn left and walk down the street to reach the nature trails. The park with skating rink is on the right hand side when leaving the home.

Drive down Richmond road for all your grocery and restaurant needs. Bayshore mall is only a 5 minute drive away.

For late night country fun, Crazy Horse is only 10 minutes away. There is also billiards, khareoke bar and a movie theatre nearby (10-15 minutes away).
host_about:
Hello!

My name's Christopher and I'm looking forward to provide you with a relaxing stay in my guest suite.

I'm a young professional with previous experience in the hospitality industry. Don't be shy to ask me questions about the unit or the area in Bells Corners. I am fully bilingual in French and English. 

I can be quiet and respect your privacy but if you need to talk I'm all ears.

name: Apartment Near Downtown Ottawa
description:
Experience Ottawa in this beautiful, newly renovated 2 bedroom apartment in the trendy Hintonburg Neighbourhood.

Just blocks away from restaurants, cafes, breweries, local shops, and so much more.

Perfect for a weekend getaway, business trip, staycation, or a cozy home base while exploring everything your Nations Capital has to offer.

host_about:
I am born and raised in Ottawa, Ontario.  I am half Italian and half Polish. I’ve spent the last few years travelling all throughout Italy, Poland, France, Germany, across the United States such as New York City, Georgia, Florida and much more.

The last few years have been tough with the world being shut down, but I’ve utilized my surroundings and make quick weekend destinations to Mont-Tremblant, Montreal, Toronto, Quebec City, Alberta and much more!

I work in media for a magazine based out of Ottawa, covering media personalities, entertainment, restaurants and much more. On the side I help my family business in property management. I manage nearly 100 units across Ottawa, I’ve had Airbnbs in my past (5) and had a lovely experience doing so. Unfortunately it came to an end once COVID hit.

name: Bright & Modern. Great Location!
description: Newly-renovated, private, luxury basement apt. with natural light in a quiet Ottawa South location. Separate entrance, 2 free parking spots & just steps to restaurants, shops & public transit. Walk or take a short drive to popular venues in Old Ottawa South & the Glebe (2 km to TD Place). Within 3 km of CHEO, Ottawa General Hospital & Carleton Uni. & only 5 km to Parliament Hill. A perfect location to enjoy bike & walking trails along the Rideau River & Canal. Monthly and weekly stay discounts.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled between Old Ottawa South and Alta Vista, Heron Park is often named Billings Bridge as it is close to Bank Street and the bridge that crosses the Rideau River into Old Ottawa South.

Walk everywhere! There is a corner store 2 blocks away. Within minutes you will find a Second Cup, Pelican Seafood and Grill, Colonnade Pizza, Icheban Bakery, Sweet Basil Thai, Hometown Sports Grill, Ten Sushi, and O' Brien's pub. This is just to name a few of the pubs and restaurants! Nearby amenities also include Farm Boy, Shoppers Drug Mart, Canadian Tire, Banks, Gas Stations, foreign money exchange and multiple other shops.

Billings Bridge Shopping mall is less than a 10 minute walk - Loblaws, Walmart, pharmacies, clothing stores, food court, natural food pantry, RBC, CIBC, TD, and pretty much anything you need.

A couple of blocks from the Airbnb listing there is a large playground, kids wading pool, ice rink, community gardens, and the Sawmill-Creek nature
host_about: I've been staying in AirBNB properties periodically for 5 years and have enjoyed some great experiences.  Recently I've decided to host my newly renovated basement apartment.  A lot of thought went into the construction materials, interior design and new furnishings and I'm pleased with the outcome. As a host, I will give my guests privacy; however, I am always available for questions. If there is anything I've missed, I will take care of it straight away!

name: Cozy & Modern- 3BR Units near Byward Market!
description: These brand new and uniquely designed apartments are a short walk from Ottawa's best restaurants, shops, and entertainment in the Byward Market. While located in the heart of downtown Ottawa, these apartments are tucked away in a residential and family filled neighborhood. There are separate and private units within the building. Each of these apartments have unique decor and are freshly renovated, with new furniture and upgraded bathrooms.
neighborhood_overview:
These apartments are in the heart of the trendy Sandy Hill district, and a short walking distance to all major downtown attractions as well as Ottawa's finest restaurants, coffee shops, museums, and art galleries.

Nearby attractions include Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, Rideau Canal, Little Italy, China Town, all of the Museums (Canadian War Museum, National Gallery, Canadian Museum of Nature, Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Canadian Museum of History, and the Canadian Museum of Space and Aviation), Commissioner's Park, Dows Lake Pavillion, several hiking trails, the waterway (popular for kayaking), and Gatineau.
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome guests from around the world to share our home and our love of the surrounding area. We understand how important a successful vacation is; the feelings you get like you're ready to take on the world again. You get to relax with family and friends and take a break from your usual routines, while promoting togetherness and creating shared memories of times spent together. 

It is our pleasure to help you create beautiful memories that will last a lifetime. Our reward is knowing your stay was relaxing, comfortable, and most of all memorable.

One of the biggest draws of Findlay Creek is its close proximity to several major highways, including the 416 and the 417, making it easy to get around the city. The neighbourhood is also located near the Ottawa International Airport, which is convenient for those who travel frequently.

Findlay Creek is predominantly a residential neighbourhood, with many single-family homes and townhouses. The homes in the area are generally newer and modern, with many featuring contemporary designs and finishes. The neighbourhood also has several parks and green spaces, which are popular with families and outdoor enthusiasts.

The fully equipped kitchen features stainless steel appliances and a large island, perfect for cooking up a delicious meal. neighborhood_overview:
Westboro, a trendy and vibrant neighborhood in Ottawa, Canada, offers a unique blend of urban chic and community charm. Nestled along the Ottawa River, this dynamic area is known for its tree-lined streets, boutique shops, and diverse dining options.

Residents of Westboro enjoy a lively arts and culture scene, with local galleries, theaters, and frequent community events. The neighborhood's commitment to public art adds a creative flair to its streets, creating an engaging and visually appealing atmosphere.

Westboro's commercial hub, Richmond Road, is a shopping haven, featuring an array of stylish boutiques, eclectic stores, and cozy cafes. It's a place where residents can explore unique finds and savor artisanal delights.

The neighborhood's proximity to outdoor spaces, including Westboro Beach and the scenic Riverwalk, invites residents to enjoy nature within an urban setting. Parks like Laroche Park provide green spaces for relaxation and recreation.

neighborhood_overview:
Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a residential neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa, Canada. It is a relatively quiet and peaceful community, consisting mainly of single-family homes and townhouses.

The neighbourhood is bordered by St. Laurent Boulevard to the west, the Aviation Parkway to the east, Ogilvie Road to the north, and the Queensway to the south. It is situated in close proximity to several amenities, including shopping centers, restaurants, parks, and schools.

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is also well-connected to public transportation, with several bus routes running through the area, providing easy access to other parts of the city. It is a diverse neighbourhood with a mix of residents from different cultural backgrounds. Overall, Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a family-friendly neighbourhood that offers a comfortable and convenient lifestyle.

name: Britannia Beach cozy room has it all!
description: It's not just a room, it's a private space close to Britannia Beach a conservation park and it has a parking spot too.  It is spacious with a private patio just for you.  If you want to reserve the hot tub, that can be arranged in advance.  It's close to the bikepath, and is on the busroute.  You can get to most areas including Kanata or downtown in 15 minutes.
neighborhood_overview:
Britannia Village is on a peninsula surrounded by water. The beach is one short block away. Beachconers pub and coffeehouse, Baja Burger shack, the Britannia Yacht Club, Mud Lake Conservation Area, a bakery and a Farm Boy all easily within walking distance. Every home is different, no cookie cutter homes here.
My garden, well, it's stupendous in Spring, Summer and Fall. I've upgraded the hot tub spa - you will feel that you are in a mini paradise. I have one bike and one kayak that I use and you can borrow if you are equipped to do so. You can use by BBQ which is located outside your entrance to the cosy room. I tend to favour the bohemian side of life - eclectic perhaps.
host_about:

The best thing about being a host:  meeting people, staying active

name: Cool Penthouse, Best Location
description:
Stylish penthouse with separate office/den, washer/dryer, fast WiFi, and 55” Roku TV with cable. In an elegant building in Ottawa’s historic heart, steps to a large park with view over the Ottawa river. Walk to dozens of restaurants and bars, food shops, supermarkets, large mall, Parliament Buildings, museums and galleries, LRT and buses. Step out the door to 200 km of hiking/biking trails.

In-building parking is available for $200 month.

A four-month minimum stay is required by condo rules.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in Ottawa's historic Lower Town neighbourhood, our condo is within walking distance of everything in downtown Ottawa, including the large Major’s Hill Park, Ottawa River, Rideau Canal walking/cycling trail, the Parliament Buildings, the four-level Rideau Mall, supermarkets, the Chateau Laurier and Westin hotels, LRT station and multiple bus lines.

You will be adjacent to the vibrant Byward Market area with its pedestrian courtyards, many restaurants and bars, specialty food shops, street-side vendors, buskers, retail stores and boutiques.

Use dedicated walking/cycling paths to go from the condo, along the historic Rideau Canal, past Dow’s Lake, Carleton University, and to the beach at Mooney’s Bay.

Or walk/cycle across the nearby bridge and visit Gatineau, Ottawa's sister city in Quebec. Gatineau features its own array of dining, shopping, entertainment, and cultural establishments including the Canadian Museum of History, Canadian Children's
host_about: The following reference from a couch surfing host in Eugene OR captures what Sue and I try to contribute as Airbnb guests and hosts: "We really enjoyed hearing about Marc and Sue's travels in parts of the world that haven't sounded as intriguing to me before this. I appreciated their good communication and commitment to being reliable guests. Doing the dinner dishes was also a happy plus. We'd be happy to host them again anytime!"

name: Entire Downtown Heritage-Style Home
description:
Beautiful 120-year old heritage-style home in West Centretown with a secluded back yard oasis and fully renovated main floor + stunning chef-grade kitchen!

Vintage HIFI system with 500+ records!

Our home is located between four of Ottawa's coolest neighbourhoods-Little Italy, Chinatown, Centretown, and Hintonburg. All within a 10-minute walk! If you want to know what spots locals call "Ottawa's best" you can check out our detailed guide too all things in the surrounding community.
neighborhood_overview:
We live downtown on a quiet street at the intersection of four of Ottawa's most interesting neighbourhoods - Centretown, Little Italy, Chinatown, and Hintonburg.

There's a beautiful park on our street, and we're just a short walk away from the Ottawa River Pathway, Dow's Lake, the Dominion Arboretum, and the Rideau Canal--and so much more!

Within walking distance, you can explore spots that the locals swear by and get a sense of what Ottawa's really about. You'll find a selection of cafes, restaurants, craft breweries, food trucks, patios, art galleries, and shops that suit just about anyone's taste. These are just some of the reasons we love to live downtown.
host_about:
I enjoy nothing more than kicking back with a nice warm cup of good coffee and listening to records. That is what I call self-care. 

I am a writer, and used to be a music blogger. I grew up in London, Ontario, and completed my BA and MA there as well. 

I moved to Ottawa in 2008 and fell in love with the city.

name: Large basement suite, king bed, kitchen and patio
description:
This is a quiet place to unwind at the end of the day, sit by the gas fireplace, watch Netflix, or sit on the outdoor patio and watch the birds, squirrels and the occasional rabbit that come say hello.

The large room with a king size bed is located in a basement with high ceilings, windows, cork flooring, a full bathroom, a separate entrance and exclusive access to the main kitchen and dining area, with everything you might need. There is also free parking.
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a quiet and friendly neighborhood in Ottawa, walking distance to Richmond road, where there are plenty of trendy restaurants, cafes and little stores, including a large grocery store.

It takes just under 30 mins on public transit to get to Parliament Hill. There are parks nearby, farmers markets, Westboro and Britannia beaches, and a trail by the river.
host_about:
I love travelling and wandering around a new place, getting a feel for the local culture. Airbnb really enables us to get immersed and explore local neighbourhoods, which I love.
My partner and I have had the chance to use Airbnb several times in different countries by now and we've had such great experiences. It's become our favourite way to travel.
I also speak French and Spanish and my partner also speaks Dutch.
Cheers to new adventures! 
Valérie

neighborhood_overview:
Situated within the Ottawa - Gatineau metropolitan area, Hawthorne Meadows is a small residential and commercial neighbourhood southeast of Ottawa’s downtown core.

Located in the Alta Vista ward, Hawthorne Meadows is a mature suburb that has become sought-after real estate thanks to its proximity to amenities, industry, parks and natural spaces, and family-friendly recreation.

Shopping Centres: Giant Tiger (corner of Melfort and Walkey), St. Laurent Shopping Centre (north on St. Laurent Blvd), and Train Yards (north on St. Laurent and west on Industrial Drive or Belfast Road). There are lots of amenities and restaurants along all the adjoining roads.
host_about:
Hey, Jesse here!

I am a professional working for the federal government. I enjoy dining out, staying active and exploring new places. I grew up in the national capital region and I used to host on Airbnb a few years ago. I am excited to start again and connect with people whether as a host or a traveler. 

While renting my renovated and private 1 bedroom lower level apartment, I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

name: Modern, spacious 1 bedroom unit.
description: Introducing a brand-new Airbnb in charming New Edinburgh. Immerse yourself in the heart of Ottawa's diplomatic community, steps away from the residences of the Prime Minister and Governor General. With scenic parks, a convenient grocery store, and easily accessible public transit nearby, this modern basement unit guarantees exceptional privacy. Experience the comforts of your own private washroom, well-equipped kitchenette, and a cozy bedroom. Enjoy a delightful stay in Canada's capital city!
neighborhood_overview:
Leafy, upscale New Edinburgh is home to the residences of the Prime Minister and the Governor General.

The area is also known for Rideau Falls Park, featuring dramatic cascades at the confluence of the Ottawa and Rideau rivers. Grab a bite to eat or treat yourself to a drink at Tavern on the Falls (1 John Street).

Want to cool off? Check out a newly restored historic landmark: NCC River House (501 Sir-George-Étienne-Cartier Pkwy), with free entry and swimming hours of 7 AM - 7 PM (July 26th to September 4, 2023). The NCC River House also includes a bistro, two wraparound balconies with stunning views of the Ottawa River. Please note the Bistro’s operating hours : 11 AM to 9 PM (May 1st - October 31), 10 AM to 2 PM (November 1st - April 30th).

Stanley Park has riverside trails and hosts the Lumière Festival with lanterns and light installations each August.

neighborhood_overview:
You’ll find multiple spots to shop in Barrhaven including Barrhaven Town Centre, Chapman Mills Marketplace, Strandherd Crossing and Barrhaven Mall. Shops include spots like Winners, Carter’s OshKosh, Plato’s closet and more! Plenty of grocery stores including Costco or more boutique shops for all your groceries.

Many pubs and restaurants in the area. Pubs and restaurants include Heart & Crown, Barley Mow, Greenfields, Broadways, Royal Oak, The Jolly Taxpayer Bar & Grill, Brown’s Socialhouse, Montana’s, Lonestar, and Eastside Mario’s to name a few.

Barrhaven has lots of parks and trails to explore. At the different parks you’ll find splash pads, soccer fields, forest trails, bike trails, wide open spaces perfect for a picnic and more.

neighborhood_overview:
Centretown, the beating heart of the city, exudes a dynamic urban energy in a compact package. This central neighborhood effortlessly merges historic charm with modern liveliness. A stroll along its tree-lined streets reveals a diverse architectural landscape, from historic homes to contemporary residences.

Culturally rich, Centretown hosts an array of galleries, theaters, and vibrant street art, celebrating local creativity. Culinary enthusiasts will delight in its diverse dining scene, offering everything from trendy bistros to international flavors. The neighborhood's green spaces provide a refreshing escape, balancing urban living with nature.

Centretown isn't just a residential haven; it's a thriving commercial hub with accessible amenities. The well-connected public transit ensures seamless connectivity, making it a convenient locale for work and leisure. In essence, Centretown encapsulates the essence of urban living, offering a lively, diverse, and conveni

name: Spacious retreat with Gardens and Gourmet Kitchen
description:
Welcome to our private urban retreat in Ottawa just a 10 min drive to parliament hill and downtown Ottawa! Stay in the nation's capital and look no further than our beautifully appointed apartment, nestled close to downtown Ottawa with the bus going by the front door.

Step into a world of refined elegance as you enter this chic, modern oasis that boasts a spacious open-concept layout with an amazing peninsula counter for gathering and beautiful gardens outside the door.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the charming neighborhood of Castle Heights in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada – a hidden gem that offers the perfect blend of urban convenience and serene surroundings. Nestled just east of the downtown core, Castle Heights provides a unique experience for visitors seeking a tranquil retreat within reach of all the city's attractions.

About the Neighbourhood:

Castle Heights is known for its tree-lined streets, well-maintained parks, and a friendly community atmosphere. This residential area boasts a mix of architectural styles, including classic brick homes, cozy cottages, and modern townhouses, creating a diverse streetscape that's a joy to explore. Its peaceful ambiance makes it a favourite among families, couples, and solo travellers looking to experience Ottawa like a local.

Things to Do:

Parks and Green Spaces: Immerse yourself in nature at the nearby parks such as Helen Redpath Thomson Park, Trojan Park, and Cummings Park, the apart

We live in a charming war time neighbourhood built around 1950. Many of the homes are 1.5 storey but several are being renovated to expand young families. Food Basics is less than a km away away.
host_about:

name: Modern 1 Bedroom in Hintonburg - FREE parking
description: Have the whole unit to yourself in this multi-unit house. Private entrance with queen sized bed and desk in the bedroom,  full kitchen/eating area, and one full bathroom with deep soaker tub. Tastefully decorated with modern accents, this unit is located on a quiet street in the trendy neighborhood of Hintonburg. Within walking distance of numerous coffee shops, restaurants, bars, and shopping. Enjoy a coffee or a drink on the patio. Parking is included with one assigned parking space.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled behind the Ottawa Civic Hospital, Hintonburg is a trendy neighborhood that has everything you need. Some may describe it as the “hipster” part of Ottawa, Hintonburg is home to one-of-a-kind coffee shops, bars, 5-star restaurants, and boutiques to satisfy all of your travel needs.
Plenty of parks in the area to be family friendly, with a tasteful bar scene to attract young professionals. Close to Little Italy, Chinatown, Westboro, Dow’s Lake, the Canal, Downtown Ottawa, and the Experimental Farm, it really is the heart of Ottawa.
host_about: Hola! My name is Marysol. I am a proud dog mom. I am looking forward to hosting you in your home away from home. If you have an questions please feel free to reach out and I will do my best to answer them as soon as possible. I hope you enjoy your stay!

name: The Loft Downtown Private Bath Parking
description:
STR 844-151
This 3rd floor loft, in a fully-renovated Century home, has a bedroom with queen bed. The double sofa bed (blue) in one of the living areas. ($25 linen fee-please advise if needed) There is a bathroom & kitchenette on your floor. A full kitchen on the second floor with stove.

neighborhood_overview:
A block from Elgin restaurants & boutiques, steps to the canal, close to Byward Market, Parliament, the Shaw Centre, and Lansdowne!

Our street is quiet, yet still a short stroll to all the excitement the city has to offer.

Pamela and Judith live on site, ready to welcome you to their home.
host_about:
We are Judith & Pamela!  We met years ago as neighbours working on volunteer projects around education and also environmental issues in our community.  We became good friends along the way.  

With our nests emptying, we decided to open a Bed and Breakfast, together.  Having worked with international clientele throughout our careers, hosting guests from out of town fits with our interests and lifestyle.  We have lots of plans to make our home and guest spaces a showcase for sustainable living. We are hoping our guests give us suggestions while they are with us!

Judith currently works as a supply teacher in the OCDSBoard. She also runs a house painting business, and a myriad of other smaller jobs. Pamela taught international teachers how to teach English as a second or foreign language;  now she works from home, teaching online and welcoming guests.  

The two of us will live in the apartment on the main level. You'll see us  in and out of the apartment during the day.

neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! Our home is in the heart of the Glebe, two blocks from TD Lansdowne, with the best amenities (shops, bakeries, restaurants, bars, breweries, yoga studios, fitness studios, spas, parks) and a ton of both summer and winter activities around.

TD Lansdowne is two blocks from us, where the 67s and Redblacks play and where concerts and comedians do shows. At Lansdowne there is an outdoor skating rink, inner rollerskating ring, outdoor skate park, basketball court, summer / fall farmers market, crafters market, dog park, a movie theatre, a fitness centre (Goodlife), Winners, Sporting Life, Whole Foods, and multiple bars & restaurants.

We are also just five minutes away from the World's largest ice rink / where you can also do water sports all summer), and a plethora of parks, biking and walking trails, and more and we have a ton of 24 hour food options nearby.

name: Cozy 1 BDRM w Parking & Patio
description: Beautiful newly renovated 1 bedroom main floor apartment with parking and walk out outdoor space on a quiet residential street. Private entrance. Perfect for couples, solo & business travellers. Located in a quiet neighbourhood with designated free parking. Your get away in Canada's capital. 8 min drive downtown which is buzzing with farmers markets to Canadian made cheese, maple syrups & beaver tails. Walking distance to grocery stores, restaurants, pubs & much more. Long term stays are welcome
neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south of Vanier, Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh. To the east, you can find the suburb of Gloucester.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.
host_about:
I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I have been an Airbnb host now for over 9 years. I love interacting with my guests and ensuring they're happy in their space. 

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.
